Author: Maurice Switzer
Quote: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform (or pause and reflect).

Author: William Shakespeare,  As You Like It
Quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Intern
Quote: When someone loves you, the way they talk about you is different. You feel safe and comfortable.

Author: Aristotle
Quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.

Author: Socrates
Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.

Author: Stephen Hawking
Quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.

Author: John Lennon
Quote: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.

Author: Isaac Asimov
Quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.

Author: Mark Twain
Quote: In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them.

Author: Langston Hughes
Quote: Hold fast to dreams,For if dreams dieLife is a broken-winged bird,That cannot fly.

Author: Jonathan Swift
Quote: May you live every day of your life.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Quote: Never laugh at live dragons.

Author: Abigail Van Buren
Quote: The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back.

Author: Aristotle,  Metaphysics
Quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: The secret of life, though, is to fall seven times and to get up eight times.

Author: Chad Sugg,  Monsters Under Your Head
Quote: If you're reading this...Congratulations, you're alive.If that's not something to smile about,then I don't know what is.

Author: Fran Lebowitz,  The Fran Lebowitz Reader
Quote: Think before you speak. Read before you think.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: Turn your wounds into wisdom.

Author: Socrates
Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.

Author: Isaac Asimov,  Foundation
Quote: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Any fool can know. The point is to understand.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist
Quote: The simple things are also the most extraordinary things, and only the wise can see them.

Author: Confucius
Quote: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.,  A Knock at Midnight: Inspiration from the Great Sermons of Reverend Martin Luther King, Jr.
Quote: Let no man pull you so low as to hate him.

Author: Jane Austen,  Pride and Prejudice
Quote: Angry people are not always wise.

Author: Elbert Hubbard
Quote: God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars.

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  The Kreutzer Sonata
Quote: It is amazing how complete is the delusion that beauty is goodness.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Lord of the Rings
Quote: It's a dangerous business, Frodo, going out your door. You step onto the road, and if you don't keep your feet, there's no knowing where you might be swept off to.

Author: Socrates
Quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: Knowing others is intelligence;knowing yourself is true wisdom.Mastering others is strength; mastering yourself is true power.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Wise Man's Fear
Quote: There are three things all wise men fear: the sea in storm, a night with no moon, and the anger of a gentle man.

Author: Colette
Quote: You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.

Author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley
Quote: The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.

Author: J.M. Barrie,  The Admirable Crichton
Quote: I'm not young enough to know everything.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche
Quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.

Author: Truman Capote
Quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.

Author: Bob Marley
Quote: Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.

Author: Jimi Hendrix
Quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens

Author: Truman Capote
Quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,That we may record our emptiness.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: The past has no power over the present moment.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world. Today I am wise, so I am changing myself.

Author: Rumi,  Masnavi i Man'avi, the spiritual couplets of Maula
Quote: Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.

Author: Thomas Paine,  A Letter Addressed to the Abbe Raynal on the Affairs of North America
Quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  It Occurred to Me
Quote: The mouth is made for communication, and nothing is more articulate than a kiss.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Fifth Mountain
Quote: There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...
Quote: Nothing, Everything, Anything, Something: If you have nothing, then you have everything, because you have the freedom to do anything, without the fear of losing something.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Lightning Thief
Quote: Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.

Author: Ludwig van Beethoven
Quote: Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy

Author: Leo Tolstoy,  War and Peace
Quote: We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.

Author: Confucius
Quote: He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.

Author: Bruce Lee
Quote: I’m not in this world to live up to your expectations and you’re not in this world to live up to mine.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: Never, never, never give in!

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’m not waiting until my hair turns white to become patient and wise. Nope, I’m dyeing my hair tonight.

Author: Patrick Ness,  A Monster Calls
Quote: You do not write your life with words...You write it with actions. What you think is not important. It is only important what you do.

Author: H.L. Mencken
Quote: The older I grow, the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.

Author: Bram Stoker,  Dracula
Quote: We learn from failure, not from success!

Author: John Keats,  Letters of John Keats
Quote: Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?

Author: Margaret Drabble
Quote: Perhaps the rare and simple pleasure of being seen for what one is compensates for the misery of being it.

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton
Quote: There comes a point when you either embrace who and what you are, or condemn yourself to be miserable all your days. Other people will try to make you miserable; don't help them by doing the job yourself.

Author: Voltaire
Quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.

Author: Charles M. Schulz
Quote: I think I've discovered the secret of life -- you just hang around until you get used to it.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: You can search throughout the entire universe for someone who is more deserving of your love and affection than you are yourself, and that person is not to be found anywhere. You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: We live in an age when unnecessary things are our only necessities.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge,  Literary Remains, Vol. 1
Quote: Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.

Author: Elizabeth Gaskell,  Wives and Daughters
Quote: Sometimes one likes foolish people for their folly, better than wise people for their wisdom.

Author: T.S. Eliot,  Four Quartets
Quote: We shall not cease from explorationAnd the end of all our exploringWill be to arrive where we startedAnd know the place for the first time.

Author: Cassandra Clare,  City of Bones
Quote: All knowledge hurts.

Author: Helen Keller
Quote: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see.

Author: Leo Buscaglia
Quote: Risks must be taken because the greatest hazard in life is to risk nothing.

Author: Dorothy Parker,  The Complete Poems of Dorothy Parker
Quote: In youth, it was a way I had,To do my best to please.And change, with every passing ladTo suit his theories.But now I know the things I knowAnd do the things I do,And if you do not like me so,To hell, my love, with you.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.

Author: Socrates
Quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.

Author: A.A. Milne
Quote: Sometimes, if you stand on the bottom rail of a bridge and lean over to watch the river slipping slowly away beneath you, you will suddenly know everything there is to be known.

Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird
Quote: Mockingbirds don’t do one thing but make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corncribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird.

Author: Anne Bradstreet
Quote: Authority without wisdom is like a heavy axe without an edge, fitter to bruise than polish.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Never complain, never explain. Resist the temptation to defend yourself or make excuses.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray
Quote: Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes.

Author: Thomas Jefferson
Quote: Honesty is the first chapter of the book wisdom.

Author: Michael Levine
Quote: Having children makes you no more a parent than having a piano makes you a pianist.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Intern
Quote: Those sweet lips. My, oh my, I could kiss those lips all night long.Good things come to those who wait.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally.

Author: Francis Bacon,  The Essays
Quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.

Author: George R.R. Martin
Quote: It is one thing to be clever and another to be wise.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Soul of Man Under Socialism, and Selected Critical Prose
Quote: The public have an insatiable curiosity to know everything, except what is worth knowing.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments
Quote: Time is a game played beautifully by children.

Author: Rumi
Quote: This being human is a guest house. Every morning is a new arrival. A joy, a depression, a meanness, some momentary awareness comes as an unexpected visitor...Welcome and entertain them all. Treat each guest honorably. The dark thought, the shame, the malice, meet them at the door laughing, and invite them in. Be grateful for whoever comes, because each has been sent as a guide from beyond.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Great Listener Seeks Mute Women
Quote: Whether you live to be 50 or 100 makes no difference, if you made no difference in the world.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha
Quote: Wisdom cannot be imparted. Wisdom that a wise man attempts to impart always sounds like foolishness to someone else ... Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom. One can find it, live it, do wonders through it, but one cannot communicate and teach it.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: If we encounter a man of rare intellect, we should ask him what books he reads.

Author: Patrick Rothfuss,  The Wise Man's Fear
Quote: Half of seeming clever is keeping your mouth shut at the right times.

Author: J.K. Rowling,  Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
Quote: As much money and life as you could want! The two things most human beings would choose above all - the trouble is, humans do have a knack of choosing precisely those things that are worst for them.

Author: Louisa May Alcott
Quote: I ask not for any crownBut that which all may win;Nor try to conquer any worldExcept the one within.

Author: George Orwell,  In Front of Your Nose: 1945-1950
Quote: The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Suffering is a gift. In it is hidden mercy.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: The only man who never makes mistakes is the man who never does anything.

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Eldest
Quote: Wise? No, I simply learned to think.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Successful people are always looking for opportunities to help others. Unsuccessful people are always asking, "What's in it for me?

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: Don’t sacrifice yourself too much, because if you sacrifice too much there’s nothing else you can give and nobody will care for you.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: She is free in her wildness, she is a wanderess, a drop of free water. She knows nothing of borders and cares nothing for rules or customs. 'Time' for her isn’t something to fight against. Her life flows clean, with passion, like fresh water.

Author: Umberto Eco,  Foucault's Pendulum
Quote: I believe that what we become depends on what our fathers teach us at odd moments, when they aren't trying to teach us. We are formed by little scraps of wisdom.

Author: Alan W. Watts
Quote: We seldom realize, for example that our most private thoughts and emotions are not actually our own. For we think in terms of languages and images which we did not invent, but which were given to us by our society.

Author: Ashley Rice
Quote: There are women who make things better... simply by showing up. There are women who make things happen. There are women who make their way. There are women who make a difference. And women who make us smile. There are women of wit and wisdom who- through strength and courage- make it through. There are women who change the world everyday... Women like you.

Author: William Arthur Ward
Quote: It is wise to direct your anger towards problems -- not people; to focus your energies on answers -- not excuses.

Author: Richard Bach,  Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah
Quote: Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness.Listen to it carefully.

Author: Martin Luther King Jr.
Quote: We must live together as brothers or perish together as fools.

Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird
Quote: When a child asks you something, answer him, for goodness sake. But don't make a production of it. Children are children, but they can spot an evasion faster than adults, and evasion simply muddles 'em.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I don't understand people who say they need more "Me Time."What other time is there? Do these people spend part of their day in someone else's body?

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
Quote: Man is a mystery. It needs to be unravelled, and if you spend your whole life unravelling it, don't say that you've wasted time. I am studying that mystery because I want to be a human being.

Author: Dorothy Parker,  The Complete Poems of Dorothy Parker
Quote: Inventory:"Four be the things I am wiser to know:Idleness, sorrow, a friend, and a foe.Four be the things I'd been better without:Love, curiosity, freckles, and doubt.Three be the things I shall never attain:Envy, content, and sufficient champagne.Three be the things I shall have till I die:Laughter and hope and a sock in the eye.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring
Quote: He that breaks a thing to find out what it is has left the path of wisdom.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  I Should Have Renamed This
Quote: If you only had 48 hours left to live, would you spend it like you normally spend your weekends? If not, why spend 2/7th of your life wasting your free time? After all, free time isn’t free. Free time is the most expensive time you have, because nobody pays for it but you. But that also makes it the most valuable time you have, as you alone stand to reap the profits from spending it wisely.

Author: Robert T. Kiyosaki
Quote: It's not what you say out of your mouth that determines your life, it's what you whisper to yourself that has the most power!

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: I AM IGNORANT of absolute truth. But I am humble before my ignorance and therein lies my honor and my reward.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  $3.33
Quote: Patience and wisdom walk hand in hand, like two one-armed lovers.

Author: Jess C. Scott
Quote: A fit, healthy body—that is the best fashion statement

Author: Cornelia Funke,  Inkheart
Quote: Books loved anyone who opened them, they gave you secruity and friendship and didn't ask for anything in return; they never went away, never, not even when you treated them badly.

Author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
Quote: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.

Author: Dan Millman,  Way of the Peaceful Warrior: A Book That Changes Lives
Quote: The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  Wicked Lovely
Quote: I felt like an animal, and animals don’t know sin, do they?

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden
Quote: As if you could kill time without injuring eternity.

Author: Joss Whedon
Quote: Recognizing power in another does not diminish your own.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Hide not your talents, they for use were made,What's a sundial in the shade?

Author: Pablo Picasso
Quote: It takes a very long time to become young.

Author: Thomas Szasz
Quote: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.

Author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Hobbit
Quote: There is more in you of good than you know, child of the kindly West. Some courage and some wisdom, blended in measure. If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Wisdom is not a product of schooling but of the lifelong attempt to acquire it.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: No man is poor who has a Godly mother.

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: Sometimes it's not enough to know what things mean, sometimes you have to know what things don't mean.

Author: William James
Quote: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.

Author: Milton Berle
Quote: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door

Author: Baltasar Gracián,  The Art of Worldly Wisdom
Quote: A wise man gets more use from his enemies than a fool from his friends.

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations
Quote: The soul becomes dyed with the colour of its thoughts.

Author: Stephen Hawking
Quote: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: V-Day…if you need this one day in a year to show everyone else you truly care for “your loved one” I think it’s quite stupid. I hate this commercialism. It’s all artificial, and has nothing to do with real love.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut
Quote: Take it moment by moment, and you will find that we are all, as I’ve said before, bugs in amber.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The House of Hades
Quote: But magic is neither good nor evil. It is a tool, like a knife. Is a knife evil? Only if the wielder is evil.

Author: Gabriel Garcí­a Márquez,  Love in the Time of Cholera
Quote: wisdom comes to us when it can no longer do any good.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: You cannot control what happens to you, but you can control your attitude toward what happens to you, and in that, you will be mastering change rather than allowing it to master you.

Author: Michel Foucault,  Madness and Civilization: A History of Insanity in the Age of Reason
Quote: People know what they do; frequently they know why they do what they do; but what they don't know is what what they do does.

Author: Jason Mraz
Quote: Transformation is my favorite game and in my experience, anger and frustration are the result of you not being authentic somewhere in your life or with someone in your life. Being fake about anything creates a block inside of you. Life can’t work for you if you don’t show up as you.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: You must give everything to make your life as beautiful as the dreams that dance in your imagination.

Author: Dan Millman,  Way of the Peaceful Warrior: A Book That Changes Lives
Quote: There are no ordinary moments.

Author: Gautama Buddha,  The Dhammapada: The Sayings of the Buddha
Quote: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise.

Author: Benjamin Franklin,  Poor Richard's Almanack
Quote: Lost Time is never found again.

Author: Shannon Hale,  Book of a Thousand Days
Quote: Mama used to say, you have to know someone a thousand days before you can glimpse her soul.

Author: Anna Godbersen,  The Luxe
Quote: Don't go looking for boys in the darkThey will say pretty things thenleave you with scars.Do go looking for boys in the parkFor that is where the true gentlemen are.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: Wisely and slow; they stumble that run fast.

Author: Ernest Hemingway,  A Farewell to Arms
Quote: No, that is the great fallacy: the wisdom of old men. They do not grow wise. They grow careful.

Author: Edna St. Vincent Millay
Quote: Into the darkness they go, the wise and the lovely.

Author: Niels Bohr
Quote: Prediction is very difficult, especially about the future.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Ender's Game
Quote: I think it's impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves.

Author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
Quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: You will not be punished for your anger; you will be punished by your anger.

Author: Scott Westerfeld,  Uglies
Quote: Perhaps the logical conclusion of everyone looking the same is everyone thinking the same.

Author: Ernest Hemingway
Quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.

Author: Ludwig van Beethoven
Quote: Don’t only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets, for it and knowledge can raise men to the divine.

Author: Stephen Fry
Quote: It's now very common to hear people say, 'I'm rather offended by that.' As if that gives them certain rights. It's actually nothing more... than a whine. 'I find that offensive.' It has no meaning; it has no purpose; it has no reason to be respected as a phrase. 'I am offended by that.' Well, so fucking what."[I saw hate in a graveyard -- Stephen Fry, The Guardian, 5 June 2005]

Author: William Stafford
Quote: Wisdom is having things right in your lifeand knowing why.

Author: Amit Ray,  Meditation: Insights and Inspirations
Quote: It does not matter how long you are spending on the earth, how much money you have gathered or how much attention you have received. It is the amount of positive vibration you have radiated in life that matters,

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Lords and Ladies
Quote: In fact, the mere act of opening the box will determine the state of thecat, although in this case there were three determinate states the catcould be in: these being Alive, Dead, and Bloody Furious.

Author: Sara Teasdale,  The Collected Poems
Quote: It is strange how often a heart must be broken Before the years can make it wise.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: In the land of Gibberish, the man who makes sense, the man who speaks clearly, clearly speaks nonsense.

Author: محمد بن إدريس الشافعي
Quote: من نمّ لك نمّ بك, ومن نقل إليك نقل عنك, ومن إذا أرضيته فقال ماليس فيك, كذلك إذا أغضبته قال فيك ماليس فيك.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: As a well spent day brings happy sleep, so life well used brings happy death.

Author: Libba Bray,  The Sweet Far Thing
Quote: There is an ancient tribal proverb I once heard in India. It says that before we can see properly we must first shed our tears to clear the way.

Author: Charles Dickens,  Hard Times
Quote: There is a wisdom of the head, and... there is a wisdom of the heart.

Author: Heinrich Heine
Quote: We should forgive our enemies, but not before they are hanged

Author: Confucius
Quote: The man of wisdom is never of two minds;the man of benevolence never worries;the man of courage is never afraid.

Author: Maya Angelou
Quote: I've learned that you shouldn't go through life with a catcher's mitt on both hands; you need to be able to throw some things back.

Author: Steve Jobs
Quote: Simple can be harder than complex: You have to work hard to get your thinking clean to make it simple. But it’s worth it in the end because once you get there, you can move mountains.

Author: Confucius
Quote: The way out is through the door. Why is it that no one will use this method?

Author: Marcel Proust
Quote: We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt,  Strenuous Life
Quote: Far better it is to dare mighty things, to win glorious triumphs, even though checkered by failure, than to take rank with those poor spirits who neither enjoy much nor suffer much, because they live in the gray twilight that knows neither victory nor defeat.

Author: Galileo Galilei
Quote: You cannot teach a man anything, you can only help him find it within himself.

Author: Bohdi Sanders,  Warrior Wisdom: Ageless Wisdom for the Modern Warrior
Quote: Never respond to an angry person with a fiery comeback, even if he deserves it...Don't allow his anger to become your anger.

Author: Mark Twain,  Notebook
Quote: Obscurity and a competence—that is the life that is best worth living.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: My head’ll explode if I continue with this escapism.

Author: Miguel Ruiz,  The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom
Quote: If others tell us something we make assumptions, and if they don't tell us something we make assumptions to fulfill our need to know and to replace the need to communicate. Even if we hear something and we don't understand we make assumptions about what it means and then believe the assumptions. We make all sorts of assumptions because we don't have the courage to ask questions.

Author: Mark Twain,  Notebook
Quote: If Christ were here there is one thing he would not be—a Christian.

Author: Octavia E. Butler
Quote: In order to rise from its own ashes, a Phoenix first must burn.

Author: D. Simone
Quote: May Light always surround you;Hope kindle and rebound you.May your Hurts turn to Healing;Your Heart embrace Feeling.May Wounds become Wisdom;Every Kindness a Prism.May Laughter infect you;Your Passion resurrect you.May Goodness inspire your Deepest Desires.Through all that you Reach For, May your arms Never Tire.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: 0 plus 100 equals 100. But so does 50 plus 50, only with more balance. Let this be a lesson in love.

Author: Robin Williams
Quote: I used to think the worst thing in life is to end up all alone. It's not. The worst thing in life is to end up with people who make you feel all alone.

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: ...Nobody knows like a woman how to say things that are both sweet and profound. Sweetness and depth, this is all of woman; this is Heaven.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: No one cares how much you know, until they know how much you care

Author: Richelle Mead,  The Fiery Heart
Quote: Don’t take the high ground and assume you already know what you’ll do. The truth is, when it comes to someone you love, you’ll find there isn’t anything you won’t do.

Author: Confucius
Quote: Only the wisest and stupidest of men never change.

Author: Wallace Stegner,  The Spectator Bird
Quote: Most things break, including hearts. The lessons of life amount not towisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.

Author: Simone Elkeles,  How to Ruin Your Boyfriend's Reputation
Quote: Expectations make people miserable, so whatever yours are, lower them. You'll definitely be happier.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Unreturned love is like trying to make a sandwich with one slice of bread. Don’t stress—fold it in half and love yourself.

Author: Frank Herbert
Quote: Education is no substitute for intelligence.

Author: C.G. Jung
Quote: Where wisdom reigns, there is no conflict between thinking and feeling.

Author: Hannah Harrington,  Speechless
Quote: Hate is... It's too easy. Love. Love takes courage.

Author: William Blake,  The Marriage of Heaven and Hell
Quote: The road of excess leads to the palace of wisdom.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Life, it’s made up of two things—time and love. A watch tells one, but what tells the other? We tell each other.

Author: أحلام مستغانمي,  الأسود يليق بك
Quote: الحب هو ذكاء المسافة، ألّا تقترب كثيرًا فتلغي اللهفة، ولا تبتعد طويلًا فتُنسى.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: Women may fall when there's no strength in men.Act II

Author: Roopleen
Quote: If you have a dream, don’t just sit there. Gather courage to believe that you can succeed and leave no stone unturned to make it a reality.

Author: Harper Lee,  To Kill a Mockingbird
Quote: Before I can live with other folks I’ve got to live with myself. The one thing that doesn’t abide by majority rule is a person’s conscience.

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry,  Le Petit Prince
Quote: Voici mon secret. Il est très simple: on ne voit bien qu'avec le cœur. L'essentiel est invisible pour les yeux.

Author: Lisa Lutz,  The Spellmans Strike Again
Quote: Our ability to adapt is amazing. Our ability to change isn't quite as spectacular.

Author: William Shakespeare,  A Midsummer Night's Dream
Quote: My soul is in the sky.

Author: Bruce Lee
Quote: It is not a daily increase, but a daily decrease. Hack away at the inessentials.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Richard III
Quote: So wise so young, they say, do never live long.

Author: Deepak Chopra
Quote: When you make a choice, you change the future.

Author: Sarah Addison Allen,  The Sugar Queen
Quote: Sometimes you weren't supposed to share pain. Sometimes it was best just to deal with it alone.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Develop an attitude of gratitude, and give thanks for everything that happens to you, knowing that every step forward is a step toward achieving something bigger and better than your current situation.

Author: Rabindranath Tagore
Quote: The small wisdom is like water in a glass:clear, transparent, pure.The great wisdom is like the water in the sea:dark, mysterious, impenetrable.

Author: Eckhart Tolle
Quote: Is there a difference between happiness and inner peace? Yes. Happiness depends on conditions being perceived as positive; inner peace does not.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The darkness has ink eyes, and if you stare long enough, you’re going to see it blink black. That’s the moment to start writing.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  Two-Part Invention: The Story of a Marriage
Quote: Love of music, of sunsets and sea; a liking for the same kind of people; political opinions that are not radically divergent; a similar stance as we look at the stars and think of the marvelous strangeness of the universe - these are what build a marriage. And it is never to be taken for granted.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: Maybe you could be mine / or maybe we’ll be entwined / aimless in this sexless foreplay.

Author: Daniel Keyes,  Flowers for Algernon
Quote: Now I understand that one of the important reasons for going to college and getting an education is to learn that the things you've believed in all your life aren't true, and that nothing is what it appears to be.

Author: Anton Chekhov
Quote: You have lost your reason and taken the wrong path. You have taken lies for truth, and hideousness for beauty. You would marvel if, owing to strange events of some sorts, frogs and lizards suddenly grew on apple and orange trees instead of fruit, or if roses began to smell like a sweating horse; so I marvel at you who exchange heaven for earth. I don't want to understand you.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love now, not later. Also, love later.

Author: A.J. Russell
Quote: All sacrifice and suffering is redemptive. It is used to either teach the individual or to help others. Nothing is by chance.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My hands will get dirty holding your rose-shaped heart, because love is like gardening—it’s earthy and takes work to keep it alive.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I had a second friend come over to my house, and do you know what I called her? A refill. If relationships aren’t drinkable, why do we thirst for them so much?

Author: Wil Zeus,  Sun Beyond the Clouds
Quote: Always forgive, but never forget, else you will be a prisoner of your own hatred, and doomed to repeat your mistakes forever.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: Coaching 101: First you build the team, and then you build the torture chamber for underperformers.

Author: John Steinbeck,  East of Eden
Quote: A man without words is a man without thought.

Author: Calvin Coolidge
Quote: It takes a great man to be a good listener.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Love isn’t in a hurry like a flurry of flowery words on paper. It’s lush and slow to grow its aroma in the garden of time.

Author: Kevin Brooks,  Lucas
Quote: It’s always hard to lose somebody. It leaves a hole in you heart that never grows back.

Author: Isaac Newton
Quote: I can calculate the motion of heavenly bodies but not the madness of people.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’ll wear a maze on a necklace, dangling over my chest, because if you want to get at my heart, you have to be ready to lose yourself.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I used to think how lucky she was to have me, but now I realize that’s backwards. A spirit of gratitude yields patience, love, and forgiveness.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: To be invisible, paint yourself with the direct shade of zero. Leave nothing to chance, by taking nothing with you wherever you go.

Author: William James
Quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  A Wrinkle in Time
Quote: I do not know everything; still many things I understand.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: Water is the softest thing, yet it can penetrate mountains and earth. This shows clearly the principle ofsoftness overcoming hardness.

Author: Anthony Robbins
Quote: I've come to believe that all my past failure and frustration were actually laying the foundation for the understandings that have created the new level of living I now enjoy.

Author: Epicurus
Quote: Death, therefore, the most awful of evils, is nothing to us, seeing that, when we are, death is not come, and, when death is come, we are not.

Author: Cornel West
Quote: Never forget that justice is what love looks like in public.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments
Quote: Even a soul submerged in sleep is hard at work and helps make something of the world.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Nothing carries meaning. People carry meaning. We are the porters of importance.

Author: Socrates
Quote: Employ your time in improving yourself by other men's writings so that you shall come easily by what others have labored hard for.

Author: Theodore Roosevelt
Quote: Every immigrant who comes here should be required within five years to learn English or leave the country.

Author: Anton Chekhov
Quote: Wisdom.... comes not from age, but from education and learning.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Look for the good in every person and every situation. You'll almost always find it.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: There’s no reason to not be humble, because as great as you may be, you can always be greater.

Author: Dante Alighieri
Quote: The wisest are the most annoyed at the loss of time.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I love letting her know how much she means to me. A love in secret is but a shadow that’s cold and lonely.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A window—it’s more entertaining than TV. Just ask a cat looking out, or a man looking in on a life he desires.

Author: Epictetus,  The Art of Living: The Classical Manual on Virtue, Happiness and Effectiveness
Quote: Don't just say you have read books. Show that through them you have learned to think better, to be a more discriminating and reflective person. Books are the training weights of the mind. They are very helpful, but it would be a bad mistake to suppose that one has made progress simply by having internalized their contents."Translation by Sharon Lebell

Author: Christopher Hitchens
Quote: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him will believeth in anything. - Hitchens 3:16

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: To become one who believes two become one, you need love in your life.

Author: Judy Blume,  Forever
Quote: That's not a bad word...hate and war are bad words, but fuck isn't.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: She doesn’t want me to leave, and she doesn’t want me to stay. That’s a double helping of Doesn’t Want Me, and one big I’m Not Hungry back at her.

Author: Lynsay Sands,  Love Bites
Quote: Time is not the great teacher. Experience is. A man may live a whole life, but if he never leaves his home to experience that life, he dies knowing nothing. A mere child who has suffered and lived can be the wiser of the two.

Author: Euripides
Quote: Anger exceeding limits causes fear and excessive kindness eliminates respect.

Author: François de La Rochefoucauld
Quote: It is easier to be wise for others than for ourselves.

Author: Walt Whitman
Quote: Re-examine all you have been told. Dismiss what insults your soul.

Author: Holly Black,  Tithe
Quote: If curiosity killed the cat, it was satisfaction that brought it back.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I think eulogies are wasted on the dead. It’s the living who need to hear kind words spoken about them.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: An attitude of positive expectation is the mark of the superior personality.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Romeo and Juliet
Quote: These violent delights have violent ends.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: No man can reveal to you aught but that which already lies half asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.The teacher who walks in the shadow of the temple, among his followers, gives not of his wisdom but rather of his faith and his lovingness.If he is indeed wise he does not bid you enter the house of his wisdom, but rather leads you to the threshold of your own mind.

Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
Quote: An acquaintance merely enjoys your company, a fair-weather companion flatters when all is well, a true friend has your best interests at heart and the pluck to tell you what you need to hear.

Author: John August,  3 Engel für Charlie
Quote: A little nonsense now and then, Is cherished by the wisest men.

Author: Nisargadatta Maharaj
Quote: Wisdom is knowing I am nothing,Love is knowing I am everything,and between the two my life moves.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My heartbeat is a pulse, and it pumps out sonic vibrations that resonate with her mind as she lays her head on my chest. Listen silently and you can hear the frequency of love.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: Love will wreck your heart like a derailed train. So choo-choose your partner wisely.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Thief of Time
Quote: When in doubt, choose to live.

Author: Eric Idle
Quote: Life doesn't make any sense, and we all pretend it does. Comedy's job is to point out that it doesn't make sense, and that it doesn't make much difference anyway.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I count as blessings things I could have benefited from, even if I neglected to utilize them. A gift is still a gift, even if left wrapped and unopened.

Author: Eve Ensler,  I am an Emotional Creature
Quote: I finally know the difference between pleasing and loving, obeying and respecting. It has taken me so many years to be okay with being different, and with being this alive, this intense. (xxvi)

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I can’t use my intellect to figure out how to bypass my intellect. Love lies through the spirit, not the mind, and love never lies.

Author: Scott Adams
Quote: Give a man a fish, and you'll feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, and he'll buy a funny hat. Talk to a hungry man about fish, and you're a consultant.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I used the boos, and not the booze, as motivation. That led to applause, which I drank up like an alcoholic. I need a refill.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Prophesies are dark and don’t need a flashlight to illuminate. I’m a bring my own lighthouse kind of lover.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Now that I’m 33.3 years old, the days of blue and green are behind me. I have left the earthy and entered into the purple phase of my life.

Author: Hermann Hesse
Quote: I will no longer mutilate and destroy myself in order to find a secret behind the ruins.

Author: Haruki Murakami,  Kafka on the Shore
Quote: The sense of tragedy - according to Aristotle - comes, ironically enough, not from the protagonist's weak points but from his good qualities. Do you know what I'm getting at? People are drawn deeper into tragedy not by their defects but by their virtues....[But] we accept irony through a device called metaphor. And through that we grow and become deeper human beings.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: If you try to change it, you will ruin it. Try to hold it, and you will lose it.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: He rose like heroes, and I rose like rows of red roses. Love grows wherever you plant it, so I try to farm it wherever I go.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A slinky is a toy made for stairs, but that’s entirely too tiresome. What about a toy for escalators that doesn’t move and does nothing and that’s the whole point? I think Americans would relate to and embrace that mentality.

Author: Winston S. Churchill
Quote: Healthy citizens are the greatest asset any country can have.

Author: Emily Brontë,  Wuthering Heights
Quote: Treachery and violence are spears pointed at both ends; they wound those who resort to them worse than their enemies.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  Mirrors of the Soul
Quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.

Author: John Russell
Quote: Sanity calms, but madness is more interesting.

Author: Eric Berne
Quote: The moment a little boy is concerned with which is a jay and which is a sparrow, he can no longer see the birds or hear them sing.

Author: Tallulah Bankhead
Quote: If I had to live my life again, I'd make the same mistakes, only sooner.

Author: Kristin Cashore,  Bitterblue
Quote: But that's how memory works,"Bitterblue said quietly. "Things disappear without your permission, then come back again without your permission."And sometimes they came back incomplete and warped.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Be mindful and heartempty, because you've got no love left in it due to you having given it all away.

Author: Michael Jackson
Quote: When they say the sky's the limit to me that's really true

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: When you give everything and expect nothing in return, only then will you be in a position to gain anything. When you love loving, you give because giving is getting. Giving is a gift unto itself, and when you realize this you understand that you can’t network if you can’t love.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Tennis is the only sport with love in the score, and that makes it the most romantic. I would be a player, but I wisely use the net to go fishing instead.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I’m passionate about being compassionate. It takes a lot to give of yourself, and that’s why it’s such a gift—for both the recipient and the giver.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: My reality is it’s nighttime. The truth is I’m just blindfolded. How many people live like me, in self-deluded darkness?

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Entrepreneurs adopt the ways of the adept and adapt to a changing environment. Actually, entrepreneurs are more enterpreneurs, because they are forever entering into new territory.

Author: Joseph Brodsky
Quote: Life—the way it really is—is a battle not between good and bad, but between bad and worse

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Great Listener Seeks Mute Women
Quote: Even a fool recognizes that there is great sadness in a bucket of tears. But only a wise man thinks to conserve water and use that bucket to wash his car.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: Yet what keeps me from dissolving right now into a complete fairy-tale shimmer is this solid truth, a truth which has veritably built my bones over the last few years--I was not rescued by a prince; I was the administrator of my own rescue.

Author: Eckhart Tolle,  The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment
Quote: I have lived with several Zen masters -- all of them cats.

Author: أحمد خيري العمري,  إدرينالين
Quote: من قال لك أن درب الجنة معبد بالورود؟

Author: Gautama Buddha,  The Dhammapada
Quote: Conquer the angry one by not getting angry; conquer the wicked by goodness; conquer the stingy by generosity, and the liar by speaking the truth.[Verse 223]

Author: Jess C. Scott,  New Order
Quote: I suppose it’s not a social norm, and not a manly thing to do — to feel, discuss feelings. So that’s what I’m giving the finger to. Social norms and stuff…what good are social norms, really? I think all they do is project a limited and harmful image of people. It thus impedes a broader social acceptance of what someone, or a group of people, might actually be like.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances, Be more active, Show up more often.

Author: Joyce Carol Oates
Quote: The worst thing: to give yourself away in exchange for not enough love.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Just when you thought you’d considered all the angles, life goes from a square to a cube. Love should also be 3D.

Author: Lisa Kleypas,  Married By Morning
Quote: There are some experiences in life they haven't invented the right words for.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Better than learning how to speak a foreign language, is to start speaking the truth. But few people will listen, because they just don’t understand.

Author: Bill Watterson
Quote: To invent your own life's meaning is not easy, but it's still allowed, and I think you'll be happier for the trouble.

Author: Orson Scott Card,  Xenocide
Quote: The wise are not wise because they make no mistakes. They are wise because they correct their mistakes as soon as they recognize them.

Author: Frank Herbert,  Dune
Quote: There is no escape—we pay for the violence of our ancestors.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: A nugget of wisdom is more valuable than a nugget of gold—and considerably harder to pan out of a river. I’ll be 33 in March, and all I’ve found so far is fool’s gold. Still, I was able to trade it for political favors.

Author: Catherynne M. Valente,  The Girl Who Circumnavigated Fairyland in a Ship of Her Own Making
Quote: Stories have a way of changing faces. They are unruly things, undisciplined, given to delinquency and the throwing of erasers. This is why we must close them up into thick, solid books, so they cannot get out and cause trouble.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: If I waste all my charity, all I’ll wind up with in the end is the wind. Still, I think I want to be the Dandelion of Love.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I wouldn’t feel great if you left me alone, but I wouldn’t feel bad either. I’d feel good, like I always do, which has nothing to do with you, even if you’ll have nothing to do with me.

Author: Paul F. Davis
Quote: If you don't feel it, flee from it. Go where you are celebrated, not merely tolerated.

Author: Roman Payne,  The Wanderess
Quote: I was an adventurer, but she was not an adventuress. She was a 'wanderess.' Thus, she didn’t care about money, only experiences - whether they came from wealth or from poverty, it was all the same to her.

Author: John Milton
Quote: I will not deny but that the best apology against false accusers is silence and sufferance, and honest deeds set against dishonest words.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: Dieting is the only game where you win when you lose!

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: I’d rather have 100% of 5 than 50% of 10—especially with love.

Author: Robin Jones Gunn,  Sisterchicks Say Ooh La La!
Quote: I look back now and realize that the gift of a true friend is that she sees you not the way you see yourself or the way others see you. A true friend sees you for who you are and who you can become.

Author: Matsuo Bashō
Quote: Do not seek to follow in the footsteps of the wise; seek what they sought.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  Complete Tales & Poems
Quote: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night. In their gray visions they obtain glimpses of eternity, and thrill, in waking, to find that they have been upon the verge of the great secret. In snatches, they learn something of the wisdom which is of good, and more of the mere knowledge which is of evil.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Relax. Just be. And be just.

Author: Lois Lowry,  The Giver
Quote: I feel sorry for anyone who is in a place where he feels strange and stupid.

Author: أبو حامد الغزالي
Quote: The happiness of the drop is to die in the river.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Relationships are like water. If you grab tight, clamping and clenching to gain control, you’ll lose it all. Instead, cup your hand gently, so she feels free to drink until her thirst is quenched.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Only a fool would say they’re not a fool. Well, I am not a fool, which is why I say I am a fool.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: My father always used to say, "Don't raise your voice. Improve your argument."Good sense does not always lie with the loudest shouters, nor can we say that a large, unruly crowd is always the best arbiter of what is right.

Author: Andrew Clements,  Things Not Seen
Quote: Two wrongs don't make a right, but don't three lefts make a right? Two wrongs don't make a right, but don't two negatives make a positive?

Author: Jasper Fforde,  Shades of Grey
Quote: Okay, this is the wisdom. First, time spent on reconnaissanse is never wasted. Second, almost anything can be improved with the addition of bacon. And finally, there is no problem on Earth that can't be ameliorated by a hot bath and a cup of tea.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: Sorrow looks back, Worry looks around, Faith looks up

Author: Lynn Marie Sager,  A River Worth Riding
Quote: People are always complaining that life's not fair, but that simply isn't true. Life is extraordinarily fair. It's just not centered on you.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Intern
Quote: Please, touch me, I pray.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: You are not your body. You are the sum of all your actions, and they live on after your body dies. You may be mortal, but your brand is eternal.

Author: Dr. Seuss,  Oh, The Places You'll Go!
Quote: When you're in a Slump,you're not in for much fun.Un-slumping yourselfis not easily done.

Author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays
Quote: Learned we may be with another man's learning: we can only be wise with wisdom of our own.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Lightning doesn’t thunder twice. Let that be a lesson in love.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: With any new business deal, don’t think about how much you can afford to get—think about how much you can afford to give. A spirit of giving will allow you to get.

Author: Homer
Quote: How prone to doubt, how cautious are the wise!

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: The act of taking the first step is what separates the winners from the losers.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Everything you do is triggered by an emotion of either desire or fear.

Author: Miguel Ruiz,  The Four Agreements: A Practical Guide to Personal Freedom
Quote: You can have many great ideas in your head, but what makes the difference is the action. Without action upon an idea, there will be no manifestation, no results, and no reward

Author: Bob Ong
Quote: Gamitin ang puso para alagaan ang taong malapit sayo. Gamitin ang utakpara alagaan ang sarili mo.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Your personal brand should be like water: not only clear, but transparent to the public. People thirst for that, and they will drink you up.

Author: Arthur C. Clarke
Quote: Before you become too entranced with gorgeous gadgets and mesmerizing video displays, let me remind you that information is not knowledge, knowledge is not wisdom, and wisdom is not foresight. Each grows out of the other, and we need them all.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Whenever You're Gone, I'm Here For You
Quote: To me, impulsive means foolish. But if a person’s not a little impulsive, they don’t have a pulse.

Author: Alexander Pope
Quote: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying in other words that he is wiser today than he was yesterday.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Love only grows by sharing. You can only have more for yourself by giving it away to others.

Author: J.R. Ward,  Crave
Quote: But that was life: Nobody got a guided tour to their own theme park. You had to hop on the rides as they presented themselves, never knowing whether you would like the one you were in line for...or if the bastard was going to make you throw up your corn dog and your cotton candy all over the place.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Zebra is the Piano of the Animal Kingdom
Quote: How many seconds does it take to win second? As many as it takes to win first—if you don’t use them properly.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Wisdom is knowing when you are being patient, and when you are wasting time by waiting.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: I cannot compromise my respect for your love. You can keep your love, I will keep my respect.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Stranger in a Strange Land
Quote: A desire not to butt into other people's business is at least eighty percent of all human wisdom.

Author: محمد عفيفي,  ترانيم في ظل تمارا
Quote: ليس كل ما يخطر للمرء يقوله ، لا سيما إذا كان صحيحا

Author: محمد الغزالي,  جدد حياتك
Quote: إلى البكائين على مافات٫ المتحيّرين وراء تحقيق المعجزات٫ الدائرين حول محور من أنفسهم يصارعون المنى وتصارعهم دون الانتهاء إلى قرار.. ألى هؤلاء نوجّه كلمة ( وليم جيمس ) : "ان بيننا وبين الله رابطة لاتنفصم٫ فإذا نحن أخضعنا أنفسنا لإشرافه-سبحانه وتعالى- تحققت أمنياتنا وآمالنا كلها

Author: Isaac Newton
Quote: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy

Author: Joe Abercrombie,  Last Argument of Kings
Quote: Travel brings wisdom only to the wise. It renders the ignorant more ignorant than ever.

Author: Philip Pullman
Quote: I'm trying to undermine the basis of Christian belief... I'm not in the business of offending people. I find the books upholding certain values that I think are important, such as life is immensely valuable and this world is an extraordinarily beautiful place. We should do what we can to increase the amount of wisdom in the world.[Washington Post interview, 19 February 2001]

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The roses of romance grow when you water your relationship with gratitude. Love will bloom and blossom when you recognize the awesome.

Author: L.M. Montgomery,  Anne of the Island
Quote: When you've learned to laugh at the things that should be laughed at, and not to laugh at those that shouldn't, you've got wisdom and understanding.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: The going rate for love is going away. And the more you go away, the more expensive it gets.

Author: Alan W. Watts
Quote: Every intelligent individual wants to know what makes him tick, and yet is at once fascinated and frustrated by the fact that oneself is the most difficult of all things to know.

Author: Marilyn Vos Savant
Quote: To acquire knowledge, one must study;but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.

Author: Gertrude Stein
Quote: Everybody gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense.

Author: Paulo Coelho,  The Alchemist

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: William Jordan

Author: Nora Roberts,  Black Rose

Author: Brian Rathbone,  Regent

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

Author: Brian Tracy

Author: Dejan Stojanovic

Author: Jodi Picoult,  Nineteen Minutes

Author: Confucius

Author: Megan McCafferty,  Second Helpings
Quote: I'VE LEARNED THAT YOU CAN'T CONTROL WHAT OTHER PEOPLE ARE GOING TO THINK ABOUT YOU.THE BEST YOU CAN DO IN LIFE IS NOT PISS YOURSELFOFF.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Leo Babauta

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Allan Rufus,  The Master's Sacred Knowledge

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Louisa May Alcott,  Little Women

Author: C. JoyBell C.

Don't be afraid of your fears, they're not there to scare you; they're there to let you know that something is worth it.

Author: Patrick Jones,  Nailed

Author: Ray Bradbury,  The Illustrated Man

Author: Tad Williams,  The Dragonbone Chair

You get into the habit of writing every day so that when she shows up, you have the maximum chance of catching her, bashing her on the head, and squeezing every last drop out of that bitch.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments

Author: George Eliot

Author: Jarod Kintz,  American Association for the Advancement of Aardvarks Presents: Dear Natalie

As soon as he gave it to me he said, “A tie would make a stronger impression on your boss if you used it as a blindfold and kidnapped him. That‘s why I bought you a black one.

Author: Aberjhani,  Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black

Author: Margaret Thatcher

Author: René Descartes,  Discourse on Method

Author: Quentin R. Bufogle

Author: Paulo Coelho

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Author: Hunter S. Thompson,  Kingdom of Fear: Loathsome Secrets of a Star-Crossed Child in the Final Days of the American Century

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Blood of Olympus

Author: C.G. Jung

Author: Melissa Marr,  Darkest Mercy

Author: Leo Babauta

Author: Ansel Adams

However-and this is a big ‘however’- most people do not ever know why their apology did not seem to have any effect. It is simply that they did not make a mistake; they made a choice…and never understood the difference between the two.

Author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

Author: Kevin Brooks,  Lucas

Author: Voltaire

Author: Edward Abbey

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Eragon

Author: Claudia Gray,  A Thousand Pieces of You

Author: Abraham Maslow

Author: Omar Khayyám,  Rubaiyat

Author: Brian Tracy

Author: Brian Tracy

Author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
Quote: Time ripens all things; no man is born wise.

Author: Milan Kundera,  The Book of Laughter and Forgetting

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Blood of Olympus

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Have Space Suit—Will Travel

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Blood of Olympus
Quote: A wind that blows aimlessly is no good to anyone.

Author: Henry James
Quote: Obstacles are those frightening things you see when you take you eyes off your goal.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments
Quote: Whoever cannot seek the unforeseen sees nothing for the known way is an impasse.

Author: Hlovate,  Rooftop Rant
Quote: We're on the same boat but in different cabin

Author: Sarah Dessen,  What Happened to Goodbye

Author: C. JoyBell C.

To learn something new is a timeless pleasure and a valuable treasure. And not all things that you learn are taught to you, but many things that you learn you realize you have taught yourself.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Thus Spoke Zarathustra
Quote: You look up when you wish to be exalted. And I look down because I am exalted.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Reading makes you ready for the world. A man who doesn’t read is a man who is easily deceived. You must find that man and make him sign a contract, and you must do it before Satan does. Trust me, the profits are HUGE!

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Title is Invisible

Author: Brian Tracy

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: Who is wise? He that learns from everyone. Who is powerful? He that governs his passions. Who is rich? He that is content. Who is that? Nobody.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein

Author: Marcus Aurelius,  Meditations

Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

Author: أبو حامد الغزالي,  The Alchemy of Happiness

Author: Thomas Fuller
Quote: A fool's paradise is a wise man's hell.

Author: Robert A. Heinlein,  Stranger in a Strange Land

Author: Paul F. Davis
Quote: The sun always shines above the clouds.

Author: Ami McKay,  The Birth House
Quote: No matter what you do, someone always knew you would.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Siddhartha

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: Fly without wings; Dream with open eyes; See in darkness.

Author: Phaedrus
Quote: Things are not always what they seem; the first appearance deceives many; the intelligence of a few perceives what has been carefully hidden.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE

Sure, it seems sweet at the time, but that’s just a carnival and carnal rush and wears off quickly. But love adds an extra dimension that takes an earthy thing like sex and makes it absolutely heavenly.

Author: Gary L. Francione

Author: Pittacus Lore,  I Am Number Four
Quote: He who doesn't understand history is doomed to repeat it.

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: Have love for your inner Self and everything else is done for you.

Author: Allan Lokos,  Pocket Peace: Effective Practices for Enlightened Living
Quote: Don't believe everything you think. Thoughts are just that - thoughts.

Author: Honoré de Balzac
Quote: for a woman knows the face of the man she loves like a sailor knows the open sea

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: For with much wisdom comes much sorrow; the more knowledge the more grief.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: We do not need to eat animals, wear animals, or use animals for entertainment purposes, and our only defense of these uses is our pleasure, amusement, and convenience.

Author: Plato,  Theaetetus

Author: Steven Moffat
Quote: The universe is big. It's vast and complicated and ridiculous. And sometimes—very rarely—impossible things just happen and we call them miracles.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: The way you give your name to others is a measure of how much you like and respect yourself.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: In the heartfelt mercy of our God, the dawn from on high will visit us, to shine on those sitting in darkness, in the shadow of death, to guide our feet to the way of peace.

Author: Socrates
Quote: The beginning of wisdom is the definition of terms.

Author: Elbert Hubbard
Quote: I would rather be able to appreciate things I cannot have than to have things I am not able to appreciate.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  At even one penny, this book would be overpriced. In fact, free is too expensive, because you'd still waste time by reading it.
Quote: At first sign of crisis, the ignorant don’t panic because they don’t know what’s going on, and then later they panic precisely because they don’t know what’s going on.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Some people are like thorns. But you have to let them be thorns, because thorns can't turn into petals. The trick is not letting them prick you; never let a thorn prick you!

Author: Benny Bellamacina,  The King of Rhyme
Quote: If you wake up tired, you’ve been chasing dreams. If you go to bed tired, your making your dreams happen.

Author: Stephen King,  The Dark Tower
Quote: He who speaks without an attentive ear is mute.

Author: Robert Fanney
Quote: May your feet ever walk in the light of two suns... and may the moonshadow never fall on you...

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Shape
Quote: I am the shore and the ocean, awaiting myself on both sides.

Author: Roopleen,  Words to inspire the winner in YOU
Quote: The world’s greatest achievers have been those who have always stayed focussed on their goals and have been consistent in their efforts.

Author: Homer,  The Iliad
Quote: Why so much grief for me? No man will hurl me down to Death, against my fate. And fate? No one alive has ever escaped it, neither brave man nor coward, I tell you - it’s born with us the day that we are born.

Author: Carson McCullers,  The Heart is a Lonely Hunter
Quote: In his face there came to be a brooding peace that is seen most often in the faces of the very sorrowful or the very wise. But still he wandered through the streets of the town, always silent and alone.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: Men have two greatest fears: the first fear is the fear of being needed, and the second fear is the fear of not being needed.

Author: Charles M. Schulz,  Peanuts Treasury
Quote: Lucy: You learn more when you lose Charlie Brown: Well then I must be the smartest person in world!!!

Author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
Quote: Where ignorance lurks, so too do the frontiers of discovery and imagination

Author: David Hume,  An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding
Quote: In our reasonings concerning matter of fact, there are all imaginable degrees of assurance, from the highest certainty to the lowest species of moral evidence. A wise man, therefore, proportions his belief to the evidence.

Author: William Blake
Quote: He who binds to himself a joyDoes the winged life destroy;But he who kisses the joy as it fliesLives in eternity's sun rise.

Author: Evanescence
Quote: Don't be afraid of the shadows, that only means there's a light nearby.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Imagine no limitations; decide what's right and desirable before you decide what's possible.

Author: John Green,  Paper Towns
Quote: Imagine others complexly.

Author: Wallace Stegner,  Angle of Repose
Quote: Wisdom. . .is knowing what you have to accept.

Author: Deepak Chopra
Quote: Non-judgment quiets the internal dialogue, and this opens once again the doorway to creativity.

Author: Phillip C. McGraw
Quote: Life's managed, not cured.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: Clear thinking at the wrong moment can stifle creativity.

Author: Leo Babauta
Quote: At the end of the day, the questions we ask of ourselves determine the type of people that we will become.

Author: Desiderius Erasmus
Quote: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.

Author: Louise Penny,  A Fatal Grace
Quote: I was tired of seeing the Graces always depicted as beautiful young things. I think wisdom comes with age and life and pain. And knowing what matters.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Excellence/Perfection is not a destination; it is a continuous journey that never ends.

Author: Douglas Coupland,  All Families are Psychotic
Quote: She thought about her life and how lost she’d felt for most of it. She thought about the way that all truths she’d been taught to consider valuable invariably conflicted with the world as it was actually lived. How could a person be so utterly lost, yet remain living?

Author: Euripides,  The Bacchae
Quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.

Author: Pope John Paul II,  Love and Responsibility
Quote: A person's rightful due is to be treated as an object of love, not as an object for use.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Write like no one is reading 3
Quote: I cry, but not for myself. There’s too much sadness in this world to waste a moment with self-pity, when making others smile will also make me smile.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: The more you seek security, the less of it you have. But the more you seek opportunity, the more likely it is that you will achieve the security that you desire.

Author: Sivananda Saraswati
Quote: This world is your best teacher. There is a lesson in everything. There is a lesson in each experience. Learn it and become wise. Every failure is a stepping stone to success. Every difficulty or disappointment is a trial of your faith. Every unpleasant incident or temptation is a test of your inner strength. Therefore nil desperandum. March forward hero!

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Write like no one is reading 3
Quote: Everyone is different from each other, but that doesn’t mean everyone should be indifferent to each other.

Author: Thomas à Kempis,  The Inner Life
Quote: The more humble and obedient to God a man is, the more wise and at peace he will be in all that he does.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: He who acts, spoils; he who grasps, lets slip.

Author: C. JoyBell C.
Quote: I would rather carry around a plastic bag with five thousand Euro inside, than carry around a Louis Vuitton/Gucci/Prada bag with only one hundred Euro inside!

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: There are many goals but one path - the path of compassion.

Author: Amor Towles,  Rules of Civility
Quote: If we only fell in love with people who were perfect for us...then there wouldn't be so much fuss about love in the first place.

Author: Henry David Thoreau,  Walden
Quote: When we are unhurried and wise, we perceive that only great and worthy things have any permanent and absolute existence, that petty fears and petty pleasures are but the shadow of the reality.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments
Quote: Wisdom is the oneness of mind that guides and permeated all things.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: We need houses as we need clothes, architecture stimulates fashion. It’s like hunger and thirst — you need them both.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: To force oneself to believe and to accept a thing without understanding is political, and not spiritual or intellectual.

Author: Dale Carnegie,  How to Win Friends and Influence People
Quote: A man convinced against his will Is of the same opinion still

Author: Aldous Huxley,  The Genius And The Goddess
Quote: God isn't the son of Memory; He's the son of Immediate Experience. You can't worship a spirit in spirit, unless you do it now. Wallowing in the past may be good literature. As wisdom, it's hopeless. Time Regained is Paradise Lost, and Time Lost is Paradise Regained. Let the dead bury their dead. If you want to live at every moment as it presents itself, you've got to die to every other moment.

Author: Confucius
Quote: The Master said, “A true teacher is one who, keeping the past alive, is also able to understand the present.”(Analects 2.11)

Author: Rae Carson,  The Girl of Fire and Thorns
Quote: From the mouths of the innocents flows truth.

Author: Zhuangzi
Quote: The wise man knows that it is better to sit on the banks of a remote mountain stream than to be emperor of the whole world.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Every minute you spend in planning saves 10 minutes in execution; this gives you a 1,000 percent Return on Energy!

Author: Natsuki Takaya
Quote: True kindness isn't something we're born with. It's something we have to work at. Not everyone has it. But I think everyone has the potential. Sometimes you just have to look really close before you can tell it's there."-Kyoko

Author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Quote: And the fox said to the little prince: men have forgotten this truth, but you must not forget it. You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  Two-Part Invention: The Story of a Marriage
Quote: We do learn and develop when we are exposed to those who are greater than we are. Perhaps this is the chief way we mature.

Author: Ellen Goodman
Quote: We spend January 1st walking through our lives, room by room, drawing up a list of work to be done, cracks to be patched. Maybe this year, to balance the list, we ought to walk through the rooms of our lives...not looking for flaws, but for potential.

Author: ياسر حارب,  بيكاسو وستاربكس
Quote: قهوتك يجب أن تكون كما تحب! “معظم الناس الذين يريدون أن يحققوا شيئا في حياتهم يركزون على نقاط ضعفهم،ويحاولون طوال حياتهم جاهدين تقويتها متناسين في نفس الوقت نقاط قوتهم , وتكون النتيجة أن تقوى نقاط ضعفهم لتوازي نقاط قوتهم التي تبقى على حالها، ليصبح الإنسان شخصا عاديًا . ” ياسر حارب*

Author: William Blake
Quote: Better to shun the bait than struggle in the snare.

Author: Oliver Sacks
Quote: In examining disease, we gain wisdom about anatomy and physiology and biology. In examining the person with disease, we gain wisdom about life.

Author: H.L. Mencken,  A Mencken Chrestomathy
Quote: We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine.

Author: Kim Gruenenfelder,  A Total Waste of Makeup
Quote: Don't be jealous of anyone. I guarantee you, if everyone walked into a room, and dumped their problems onto the floor, when they saw what everyone else's problems were, they'd be scrambling to get their own problems back before someone else got to them first.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: A person is a person through other persons.None of us comes into the world fully formed. We would not know how to think, or walk, or speak, or behave as human beings unless we learned it from other human beings. We need other human beings in order to be human. I am because other people are. A person is entitled to a stable community life, and the first of these communities is the family.

Author: Allan Rufus
Quote: Life is like a sandwich!Birth as one slice,and death as the other.What you put in-between the slices is up to you.Is your sandwich tasty or sour?Allan Rufus.org

Author: Madeleine L'Engle
Quote: It takes too much energy to be against something unless it's really important.

Author: Maggie Stiefvater,  The Scorpio Races
Quote: Mum liked to say that some things happen for a reason, that sometimes obstacles were there to stop you from doing something stupid.

Author: Nalini Singh,  Angels' Blood
Quote: Only ignorance excuses stupidity

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: When she was a child, my love carried a road-map in her hand the way other girls carried handkerchiefs. She always knew the way. Her feet were little wings. And her beautiful head was a compass.

Author: Xiaolu Guo
Quote: Its important to be comfortable with uncertainty.

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: Great spirits have always encountered opposition from mediocre minds. The mediocre mind is incapable of understanding the man who refuses to bow blindly to conventional prejudices and chooses instead to express his opinions courageously and honestly.

Author: John Dewey
Quote: Failure is instructive. The person who really thinks learns quite as much from his failures as from his successes.

Author: Karl Popper
Quote: Whenever a theory appears to you as the only possible one, take this as a sign that you have neither understood the theory nor the problem which it was intended to solve.

Author: G.K. Chesterton
Quote: Humor can get in under the door while seriousness is still fumbling at the handle.

Author: Anthony de Mello,  One Minute Wisdom
Quote: Wisdom tends to grow in proportion to one's awareness of one's ignorance.

Author: Clive Barker
Quote: Writing about the unholy is one way of writing about what is sacred.

Author: Anonymous,  Bhagavad Gita: El Canto del Senor
Quote: The immature think that knowledge and action are different, but the wise see them as the same.

Author: Joseph Campbell
Quote: The fates lead him who will; him who won't they drag.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This is the story my great-grandfather told my father, who then told my grandfather, who then told me about how The Mythical Mr. Boo, Charles Manseur Fizzlebush Grissham III, better known as Mr. Fizzlebush, and Orafoura are all in fact me...
Quote: I may be alive now, but in a series of moments I won’t be. And let it be said about me: He didn’t waste his time talking to conch shells, but he did listen to what they had to say about the ocean.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: If you envy successful people, you create a negative force field of attraction that repels you from ever doing the things that you need to do to be successful.
