If you admire successful people, you create a positive force field of attraction that draws you toward becoming more and more like the kinds of people that you want to be like.

Author: George Orwell,  Animal Farm
Quote: Windmill or no windmill, he said, life would go on as it had always gone on--that is, badly.

Author: David Norris
Quote: How you spend your time is more important than how you spend your money. Money mistakes can be corrected, but time is gone forever.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: The rule of the universe is that others can do for us what we cannot do for ourselves, and one can paddle every canoe except one's own.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: The more credit you give away, the more will come back to you. The more you help others, the more they will want to help you.

Author: Anthony de Mello
Quote: If what you seek is Truth, there is one thing you must have above all else.” “I know. An overwhelming passion for it.” “No. An unremitting readiness to admit you may be wrong.

Author: Hamza Yusuf
Quote: The weak are dominated by their ego, the wise dominate their ego, and the intelligent are in a constant struggle against their ego.

Author: Ming-Dao Deng
Quote: All teachings are mere references. The true experience is living your own life. Then, even the holiest of words are only words.

Author: Gloria E. Anzaldúa
Quote: Caminante, no hay puentes, se hace puentes al andar. (Voyager, there are no bridges, one builds them as one walks.)

Author: J.L. Carr,  A Month in the Country
Quote: And, at such a time, for a few of us there will always be a tugging at the heart—knowing a precious moment had gone and we not there. We can ask and ask but we can’t have again what once seemed ours for ever—the way things looked, that church alone in the fields, a bed on belfry floor, a remembered voice, a loved face. They’ve gone and you can only wait for the pain to pass.

Author: William Saroyan
Quote: It takes a lot of rehearsing for a man to be himself.

Author: Jim Butcher,  White Night
Quote: Everyone is down on pain, because they forget something important about it: Pain is for the living. Only the dead don't feel it.

Author: Jack Kerouac,  The Dharma Bums
Quote: Aw I don't wanta go to no such thing, I just wanta drink in alleys.'...But you'll miss all that, just for some old wine.'There's wisdom in wine, goddam it!' I yelled. 'Have a shot!

Author: Merritt Y. Hughes,  Ten Perspectives on Milton
Quote: God is the supreme uncreated light of which Wisdom is born, but there was never a time when God's Wisdom did not exist.

Author: أحمد الشقيري,  خواطر شاب
Quote: أمران سيجعلانك أكثر حكمة...الكتب التى تقرؤها والأشخاص الذين تلتقى بهم.

Author: Kahlil Gibran
Quote: Your pain is the breaking of the shell that encloses your understanding.

Author: Socrates
Quote: I only know that I know nothing

Author: Nicolaus Copernicus
Quote: To know that we know what we know, and to know that we do not know what we do not know, that is true knowledge.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Witches Abroad
Quote: Wisdom is one of the few things that looks bigger the further away it is.

Author: Amy Poehler
Quote: It’s never overreacting to ask for what you want and need.

Author: Queen Elizabeth I
Quote: I observe and remain silent.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  The Darker Side of Life
Quote: The brightest light casts the darkest shadow.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: I was flipping channels, watching this cheerleading program on MTV. They took a field hockey girl and “transformed” her into a cheerleader by the end of the show. I was just wondering: what if she liked field hockey better?

Author: Andy Rooney
Quote: I've learned .... That opportunities are never lost; someone will take the ones you miss.

Author: Michael Crichton,  Eaters of the Dead
Quote: Praise not the day until evening has come, a woman until she is burnt, a sword until it is tried, a maiden until she is married, ice until it has been crossed, beer until it has been drunk.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: With age comes wisdom, but sometimes age comes alone.

Author: Catherynne M. Valente,  The Girl Who Circumnavigated Fairyland in a Ship of Her Own Making
Quote: Hats have power. Hats can change you into someone else.

Author: Mahatma Gandhi
Quote: Non-violence, which is the quality of the heart, cannot come by an appeal to the brain.

Author: L.J. Smith,  The Forbidden Game
Quote: The image isn't reality. Even though we're used to thinking that way alot of the time. We show a kid a picture of a dog and say 'This is a doggie' - but it's not. It's just an image.

Author: Jodi Picoult,  My Sister's Keeper
Quote: well, sometimes to get what you want the most, you have to do what you want the least.

Author: Oscar Wilde,  The Picture of Dorian Gray
Quote: But then one regrets the loss even of one's worst habits. Perhaps one regrets them the most. They are such an essential part of one's personality.

Author: Christopher Moore,  Lamb: The Gospel According to Biff, Christ's Childhood Pal
Quote: Routine feeds the illusion of safety...

Author: Adam Gidwitz,  A Tale Dark & Grimm
Quote: You see, to find the brightest wisdom one must pass through the darkest zones. And through the darkest zones there can be no guide. No guide, that is, but courage

Author: حنان اللحام,  هدي السيرة النبوية في التغيير الاجتماعي
Quote: اصحاب العقول الواقفة عند حرفية النص-قرانا وسنة- كثيرا ما تفلت منهم المقاصد والمنافع فيمشون على وجوههم

Author: Dale Carnegie
Quote: you can measure the size of a person by what makes him or her angry

Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Quote: Never question another man's motive. His wisdom, yes, but not his motives.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Entreat me not to leave thee, or to return from following after thee: For wither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge: Thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Disciplining yourself to do what you know is right and importance, although difficult, is the highroad to pride, self-esteem, and personal satisfaction.

Author: Johnny Depp
Quote: With every part you act, there must be a little of yourself in it. If there isn't, it's not acting. It's lying.

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  Crime and Punishment
Quote: He was one of the numerous and varied legion of dullards, of half-animated abortions, conceited, half-educated coxcombs, who attach themselves to the idea most in fashion only to vulgarize it and who caricature every cause they serve, however sincerely.

Author: Siobhan Vivian,  Not That Kind of Girl
Quote: You see, the best thing about wrong decisions is that they don’t prevent you from making the right decisions later on. It’s harder, but it’s not impossible.

Author: Hannah Hart
Quote: Nobody is wired wrong, because there’s no wrong and right in the way we are.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: No one lives long enough to learn everything they need to learn starting from scratch. To be successful, we absolutely, positively have to find people who have already paid the price to learn the things that we need to learn to achieve our goals.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Today the greatest single source of wealth is between your ears.

Author: Natsuki Takaya
Quote: I'm not sure why I've decided to do this. I'm not any stronger than I was, and nothing else has changed. But all the same, this time I'm not going to run away. It's okay to feel weak sometimes. It's okay to be afraid. The important thing is that we face our fears. That's what makes us strong."-Yuki

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Opportunity is not your opponent—it is your ally, but it’s hard to see that because opportunity is often camouflaged and hidden among danger and chaos.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: The barrier during self-improvement is not so much that we hate learning, rather we hate being taught. To learn entails that the knowledge was achieved on one's own accord - it feels great - but to be taught often leaves a feeling of inferiority. Thus it takes a bit of determination and a lot of humility in order for one to fully develop.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Communication is a skill that you can learn. It's like riding a bicycle or typing. If you're willing to work at it, you can rapidly improve the quality of very part of your life.

Author: Anne Frank,  The Diary of a Young Girl
Quote: The best remedy for those who are afraid, lonely or unhappy is to go outside, somewhere where they can be quite alone with the heavens, nature and God.

Author: Alan Cohen
Quote: Scared and sacred are spelled with the same letters. Awful proceeds from the same root word as awesome. Terrify and terrific. Every negative experience holds the seed of transformation.

Author: Shunryu Suzuki,  Zen Is Right Here: Teaching Stories and Anecdotes of Shunryu Suzuki, Author of "ZEN Mind, Beginner's Mind"
Quote: A student, filled with emotion and crying, implored, "Why is there so much suffering?"Suzuki Roshi replied, "No reason.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Carpe Jugulum
Quote: Granny was an old-fashioned witch. She didn’t do good for people, she did right by them.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Hamlet
Quote: There's a divinity that shapes our ends,Rough-hew them how we will.

Author: Heraclitus,  Fragments
Quote: People ought to fight to keep their law as to defend the citys walls.

Author: Napoleon Hill
Quote: Wise men, when in doubt whether to speak or to keep quiet, give themselves the benefit of the doubt, and remain silent.

Author: Wallace Stegner,  The Spectator Bird
Quote: The lessons of life amount not to wisdom, but to scar tissue and callus.

Author: George Washington
Quote: Experience teaches us that it is much easier to prevent an enemy from posting themselves than it is to dislodge them after they have got possession.

Author: Charles Kingsley,  The Water-Babies
Quote: The most wonderful and the strongest things in the world, you know, are just the things which no one can see.

Author: Desmond Tutu
Quote: If you are neutral in situations of injustice, you have chosen the side of the oppressor.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  The Way of Kings
Quote: Ignorance is hardly unusual, Miss Davar. The longer I live, the more I come to realize that it is the natural state of the human mind. There are many who will strive to defend its sanctity and then expect you to be impressed with their efforts.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson,  The Essays of Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: At times the whole world seems to be in conspiracy to importune you with emphatic trifles. Friend, client, child, sickness, fear, want, charity, all knock at once at thy closet door and say,—'Come out unto us.' But keep thy state; come not into their confusion. The power men possess to annoy me I give them by a weak curiosity. No man can come near me but through my act.

Author: Marion Zimmer Bradley
Quote: To know you are ignorant is the beginning of wisdom.

Author: Evanescence
Quote: Forget the place you're trying to get to and see the beauty in right now...

Author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
Quote: A wise man always has something to say, whereas a fool always needs to say something.

Author: John Berryman
Quote: I am so wise I had my mouth sewn shut.

Author: Confucius
Quote: Knowledge is merely brilliance in organization of ideas and not wisdom. The truly wise person goes beyond knowledge.

Author: William Shakespeare,  Twelfth Night
Quote: Journeys end in lovers meeting, Every wise man's son doth know.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: Who we were and who we are are four different people, and the me from now doesn't relate to the me from then, let alone to the you from now.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The moon will guide you through the night with her brightness, but she will always dwell in the darkness, in order to be seen.

Author: Amit Ray,  World Peace: The Voice of a Mountain Bird
Quote: If you want to fly on the sky, you need to leave the earth. If you want to move forward, you need to let go the past that drags you down.

Author: Harper Lee
Quote: Everybody’s gotta learn, nobody’s born knowing.

Author: Beth Johnson
Quote: When something seems wrong in your life, the only way to have resolution with it is to let it go. Trying to make it right keeps it wrong.

Author: Lao Tzu,  Tao Te Ching
Quote: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.

Author: Charles Dickens,  Nicholas Nickleby
Quote: Dreams are the bright creatures of poem and legend, who sport on earth in the night season, and melt away in the first beam of the sun, which lights grim care and stern reality on their daily pilgrimage through the world.

Author: Lorraine Heath,  Surrender to the Devil
Quote: Life is a journey, Frannie darling,"Feagan had once told me. "Choose well those with whom you travel."As always, I've followed Feagan's counsel.

Author: Hermann Hesse,  Narcissus and Goldmund
Quote: I call that man awake who, with conscious knowledge and understanding, can perceive the deep unreasoning powers in his soul, his whole innermost strength, desire and weakness, and knows how to reckon with himself.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: Veganism is not a "sacrifice."It is a joy.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Never say anything about yourself you don't want to come true

Author: Dan Millman,  Way of the Peaceful Warrior: A Book That Changes Lives
Quote: Where are you? HereWhat time is it? NowWhat are you? This moment.

Author: Ernesto Che Guevara
Quote: The revolution is not an apple that falls when ripe. You have to make it fall.

Author: محمد بن إدريس الشافعي,  ديوان الإمام الشافعي
Quote: و ميز كلامك قبل الكلام… فإن لكل كلام جوابفرب كلام يمص الحشى … و فيه من المزح ما يستطاب

Author: David Rovics
Quote: They'll say you are bador perhaps you are mador at least you should stay undercover.Your mind must be bareif you would dareto think you can love more than one lover.

Author: Scott Lynch,  The Lies of Locke Lamora
Quote: Advice,"Doña Vorchenza chuckled. "Advice. The years play a sort of alchemical trick, transmuting one's mutterings to a state of respectability. Give advice at forty and you're a nag. Give it at seventy and you're a sage.

Author: Oscar Wilde
Quote: It is a very sad thing that nowadays there is so little useless information.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  Words of Radiance
Quote: Jasnah had once defined a fool as a person who ignored information because it disagreed with desired results.

Author: Michael Bassey Johnson
Quote: I don't fancy colors of the face, I'm always attracted to colors of the brain.

Author: Elise Broach,  Shakespeare's Secret
Quote: My dad always says, some people will treat you badly and you can't help that. But how you handle it and how it makes you feel, that's up to you.

Author: Mikhail Naimy,  The Book of Mirdad: The Strange Story of a Monastery Which Was Once Called the Ark
Quote: Ask not of things to shed their veils. Unveil yourselves, and things will be unveiled.

Author: Yvon Chouinard,  Let My People Go Surfing: The Education of a Reluctant Businessman
Quote: The more you know, the less you need.

Author: John Brunner,  The Shockwave Rider
Quote: There are two kinds of fools. One says, "This is old, and therefore good."And one says, "This is new, and therefore better.

Author: Terry Pratchett,  Wintersmith
Quote: And, as always happens, and happens far too soon, the strange and wonderful becomes a memory and a memory becomes a dream. Tomorrow it's gone.

Author: Kurt Vonnegut,  Breakfast of Champions
Quote: Earthlings went on being friendly, when they should have been thinking instead.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The most important thing is this: to sacrifice what you are now for what you can become tomorrow.

Author: Brett Harris
Quote: The beauty of collaboration between older and younger generations is that we combine strength with wisdom—a surefire way to accomplish more for the glory of God.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: My father taught me that you can you read a hundred books on wisdom and write a hundred books on wisdom, but unless you apply what you learned then its only words on a page. Life is not lived with intentions, but action.

Author: Anthony de Mello,  One Minute Wisdom
Quote: When you come to see you are not as wise today as you thought you were yesterday, you are wiser today.

Author: Milan Kundera,  The Book of Laughter and Forgetting
Quote: When Don Quixote went out into the world, that world turned into a mystery before his eyes. That is the legacy of the first European novel to the entire subsequent history of the novel. The novel teaches us to comprehend the world as a question. There is wisdom and tolerance in that attitude.

Author: Al Munoz
Quote: If you're not happy in life then you need to change, calibrate, readjust...flush your negative energy and fill it with positive energy; How do we do that you might ask? well I would start by making others happy, deseases are not the only thing that spreads easy. We are all connected in some form of unseen energy... think how those around you will impact you and make you feel if they were happy?

Author: Seneca
Quote: errare humanum est, sed perseverare diabolicum: 'to err is human, but to persist (in the mistake) is diabolical.

Author: Marshall McLuhan,  The Gutenberg Galaxy: The Making of Typographic Man
Quote: A point of view can be a dangerous luxury when substituted for insight andunderstanding.

Author: Edith Wharton
Quote: To know when to be generous and when firm—that is wisdom.

Author: Andy Andrews,  The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective
Quote: One way to define wisdom is the ability to see, into the future, the consequences of your choices in the present. That ability can give you a completely different perspective on what the future might look like.

Author: Sarah Rees Brennan,  The Demon's Covenant
Quote: I don't trust men everybody likes. Being nice isn't the same as being good.

Author: Sogyal Rinpoche
Quote: Don't you notice that there are particular moments when you are naturally inspired to introspection? Work with them gently, for these are the moments when you can go through a powerful experience, and your whole worldview can change quickly.

Author: Laura Munson,  This Is Not The Story You Think It Is...: A Season of Unlikely Happiness
Quote: Probably the wisest words that were ever uttered to me. Came from a therapist. I was sitting in her office, crying my eyes out. . . and she said, "So let me get this straight. You base your personal happiness on things entirely out of your control.

Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
Quote: Let mental culture go on advancing, let the natural sciences progress in even greater extent and depth, and the human mind widen itself as much as it desires: beyond the elevation and moral culture of Christianity, as it shines forth in the Gospels, it will not go.

Author: Henry Ward Beecher
Quote: Adversity, if for no other reason, is of benefit, since it is sure to bring a season of sober reflection. People see clearer at such times. Storms purify the atmosphere.

Author: Dion Boucicault
Quote: Men talk of killing time, while time quietly kills them.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: A good traveler leaves no tracks. Good speech lacks fault-finding.

Author: Aesop
Quote: No one believes a liar even when he tells the truth

Author: Rick Ross
Quote: How many people you bless is how you measure success

Author: Askhari Johnson Hodari,  Lifelines: The Black Book of Proverbs
Quote: If everyone helps to hold up the sky, then one person does not become tired.

Author: Robert Jordan
Quote: You can never know everything. Part of what you know is always wrong. Perhaps the most important part. A portion of wisdom lies in knowing that. A portion of knowledge lies in going on anyway.

Author: Robert Burns,  Collected Poems of Robert Burns
Quote: There is no such uncertainty as a sure thing.

Author: Zhuangzi
Quote: Forget the years, forget distinctions. Leap into the boundless and make it your home!

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: Night is certainly more novel and less profane than day.

Author: Aberjhani,  The River of Winged Dreams
Quote: Love taught me to die with dignity that I might come forth anew in splendor. Born once of flesh, then again of fire, I was reborn a third time to the sound of my name humming haikus in heaven’s mouth.

Author: Jerome K. Jerome,  Three Men in a Boat
Quote: We must not think of the things we could do with, but only of the things that we can't do without.

Author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin
Quote: It doesn't matter if the water is cold or warm if you're going to have to wade through it anyway.

Author: Baltasar Gracián
Quote: Without courage, wisdom bears no fruit.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: Fashion and music are the same, because music express its period too.

Author: Michel de Montaigne
Quote: There were many terrible things in my life and most of them never happened.

Author: Karl Lagerfeld
Quote: When people want to be liked for what they did, they should stop.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: A clear vision, backed by definite plans, gives you a tremendous feeling of confidence and personal power.

Author: Kay Redfield Jamison
Quote: Knowledge is marvelous, but wisdom is even better.

Author: Orison Swett Marden
Quote: Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance, order, rhythm and harmony.

Author: Carole Wilkinson,  Dragon Keeper
Quote: It is because of its emptiness that the cup is useful.

Author: William Wordsworth
Quote: Habit rules the unreflecting herd.

Author: Andrew Davidson
Quote: You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough.

Author: John Emerich Edward Dalberg-Acton
Quote: A wise person does at once, what a fool does at last. Both do the same thing; only at different times.

Author: Kahlil Gibran,  The Prophet
Quote: He who is more mindful of one, loses the love and the faith of both.

Author: Jules Verne,  The Mysterious Island
Quote: It seems wisest to assume the worst from the beginning...and let anything better come as a surprise.

Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
Quote: Errors do not cease to be errors simply because they’re ratified into law.

Author: Patañjali,  The Yoga Sutras of Patanjali
Quote: Yoga is the cessation of the movements of the mind. Then there is abiding in the Seer's own form.

Author: Glen Cook,  Soldiers Live
Quote: Soldiers live. He dies and not you, and you feel guilty, because you're glad he died, and not you. Soldiers live, and wonder why.

Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
Quote: It was not curiosity that killed the goose who laid the golden egg, but an insatiable greed that devoured common sense.

Author: Andy Rooney
Quote: the best classroom in the world is at the feet of an elderly person.

Author: Plato
Quote: Wise men talk because they have something to say; Fools, because they have to say something.

Author: Isaac Asimov,  Pebble in the Sky
Quote: Old men tend to forget what thought was like in their youth; they forget the quickness of the mental jump, the daring of the youthful intuition, the agility of the fresh insight. They become accustomed to the more plodding varieties of reason, and because this is more than made up by the accumulation of experience, old men think themselves wiser than the young.

Author: Amit Ray,  Om Chanting and Meditation
Quote: Penetrate deep into the word "Om". Gradually the word will disappear and only the silence will remain. The word is a support. The meaning is within you. Om brings out that meaning which is hidden in your soul.

Author: Andy Andrews,  The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective
Quote: See, the ‘small stuff’ is what makes up the larger picture of our lives. Many people are like you, young man. But their perspective is distorted. They ignore ‘small stuff,’ claiming to have an eye on the bigger picture, never understanding that the bigger picture is composed of nothing more than-are you ready?- ‘small stuff’.

Author: Marcus Porcius Cato
Quote: Wise men profit more by fools than fools by wise men.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: There is another alphabet, whispering from every leaf, singing from every river, shimmering from every sky.

Author: Rumi
Quote: How will you know the difficulties of being human, if you are always flying off to blue perfection? Where will you plant your grief seeds? Workers need ground to scrape and hoe, not the sky of unspecified desire.

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Inheritance
Quote: He's acting as foolish as a kitten... but then, everyone's entitled to a little foolishness once in a while.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: I don't own the sunset, but I have a free yearly membership to stream whenever it's on, and this is a life perk that makes me wealthy.

Author: Harshit Walia
Quote: Whole life is a search for beauty. But, when the beauty is found inside, the search ends and a beautiful journey begins.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Escalators are the offspring of elevators and stairs. Love is the progeny of passion and admiration.

Author: Suzanne Crowley,  The Very Ordered Existence of Merilee Marvelous
Quote: There's a thin line between genius and bottom-barrel stupidness. I hover delicately on a tightrope between the two, wondering where I'll land if I'll ever fall.

Author: Andy Andrews,  The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective
Quote: While it is true that most people never see or understand the difference they make, or sometimes only imagine their actions having a tiny effect, every single action a person takes has far-reaching consequences.

Author: Christine de Pizan,  The Book of the City of Ladies
Quote: Not all men (and especially the wisest) share the opinion that it is bad for women to be educated. But it is very true that many foolish men have claimed this because it displeased them that women knew more than they did.

Author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
Quote: To finish the moment, to find the journey's end in every step of the road, to live the greatest number of good hours, is wisdom.

Author: Benjamin Hoff,  The Te of Piglet
Quote: It is very hard to be brave,"said Piglet, sniffing slightly, "when you're only a Very Small Animal."Rabbit, who had begun to write very busily, looked up and said: "It is because you are a very small animal that you will be Useful in the adventure before us.

Author: Jess C. Scott,  EyeLeash: A Blog Novel
Quote: [novan]: bassists are very good with their fingers[novan]: and some of us sing backup vocals, so that means we're good with our mouths too...(~ IM chat with Novan Chang, 18, bassist)

Author: Albert Einstein
Quote: If one tries to navigate unknown waters one runs the risk of shipwreck

Author: Laurell K. Hamilton,  Incubus Dreams
Quote: I used to think I knew what was right and what was wrong, and who the good guys are, and who the bad guys are. Then the world got very gray, and I didn't know anything for a long time

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Sun Watches the Sun
Quote: Even if you are alone you wage war with yourself.

Author: Mortimer J. Adler,  How to Read a Book: The Classic Bestselling Guide to Reading Books and Accessing Information
Quote: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom in learning from books as well as from nature.

Author: Ana Monnar,  Relax: New And Selected Poems: New And Selected Poems
Quote: At times anger will trigger harsh words. After a cooling period wisdom sets in; finally, the ability to speak from the heart with love and compassion.

Author: Rumi,  Love: The Joy That Wounds: The Love Poems of Rumi
Quote: Bitter your acts, bitter am I,Kindness your deeds, kindness am I,Pleasant and gentle, so you are,Fine honeyed lips and sweet talker.

Author: Bertrand Russell
Quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.

Author: Vera Nazarian,  The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration
Quote: The master of the garden is the one who waters it, trims the branches, plants the seeds, and pulls the weeds. If you merely stroll through the garden, you are but an acolyte.

Author: Rachel Naomi Remen
Quote: Perhaps wisdom is simply a matter of waiting, and healing a question of time. And anything good you've ever been given is yours forever.

Author: Gregory Bassham,  The Ultimate Harry Potter and Philosophy: Hogwarts for Muggles
Quote: To pursue wisdom is to live in such a way that one is prepared to face death when it comes. (247)

Author: Bob Dylan
Quote: They say that patriotism is the last refuge to which a scoundrel clings steal a little and they throw you in jail. Steal a lot and then they make you king.

Author: Thomas McGuane
Quote: It don't do you no nevermind to tell nobody nothing.

Author: Mary Norton,  The Borrowers Afield
Quote: Misfortunes make us wise

Author: W. Somerset Maugham,  Theatre
Quote: Never pause unless you have a reason for it, but when you pause, pause as long as you can.

Author: Dale Carnegie
Quote: there is only one way under high heaven to get the best of an argument - and that is to avoid it .

Author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  Crime and Punishment
Quote: Intelligence alone is not nearly enough when it comes to acting wisely.

Author: Alison Croggon,  The Naming
Quote: You have a great heart, but will only find it to be so through great pain. This is the wisdom of love, and its doubtful gift. . . . I have endured much suffering and still remain unbitter and unclosed.

Author: Pope John Paul II,  Love and Responsibility
Quote: Friendship, as has been said, consists in a full commitment of the will to another person with a view to that person's good.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: re-examine all you have been told in school or church or in any book, and dismiss whatever insults your own soul; and your very flesh shall be a great poem, and have the richest fluency, not only in its words, but in the silent lines of its lips and face, and between the lashes of your eyes, and in every motion and joint of your body.[From the preface to Leaves Grass]

Author: Pope Benedict XVI,  Jesus of Nazareth: From the Baptism in the Jordan to the Transfiguration
Quote: Purity of heart is what enables us to see.

Author: Sacha Guitry
Quote: Our wisdom comes from our experience,and our experience comes from our foolishness.

Author: Mark Twain,  Joan of Arc
Quote: To believe yourself brave is to be brave; it is the one only essential thing.

Author: حنان اللحام,  هدي السيرة النبوية في التغيير الاجتماعي
Quote: من لم يتحرر من الاكراه في صورتيه: اكراه الاخر والخضوع للاخر، لايستطيع فهم هذا الدين وتمثيله

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: To risk life to save a smile on a face of a woman or a child is the secret of chivalry.

Author: Plato
Quote: Ideas are the source of all things

Author: Michel de Montaigne
Quote: I listen with attention to the judgment of all men;but so far as I can remember,I have followed none but my own.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Your biggest opportunity probably lies under your own feet, in your current job, industry, education, experience or interests.

Author: Rumi,  The Essential Rumi
Quote: Knowledge that is acquiredis not like this. Those who have it worry ifaudiences like it or not.It's a bait for popularity.Disputational knowing wants customers.It has no soul...The only real customer is God.Chew quietlyyour sweet sugarcane God-Love, and stayplayfully childish.

Author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr.
Quote: When I think of talking, it is of course with a woman. For talking at its best being an inspiration, it wants a corresponding divine quality of receptiveness, and where will you find this but in a woman?

Author: Thomas Fuller
Quote: We never know the worth of water till the well is dry.

Author: Sam Keen,  Fire in the Belly: On Being a Man
Quote: Burnout is nature's way of telling you, you've been going through the motions your soul has departed; you're a zombie, a member of the walking dead, a sleepwalker. False optimism is like administrating stimulants to an exhausted nervous system.

Author: Guru Nanak,  Sri Guru Granth Sahib
Quote: Burn worldly love, rub the ashes and make ink of it, make the heart the pen, the intellect the writer, write that which has no end or limit.

Author: R.L. LaFevers,  Dark Triumph
Quote: Jewels can be replaced, cousin. Independence, once lost, cannot.

Author: Eric Micha'el Leventhal
Quote: Each person you meetis an aspect of yourself,clamoring for love.

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Education is beautification of the inner world and the outer world.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: I know a girl from whose body sunbeams rose to the clouds as if they’d fallen from the sun.Her laugh was like a bangle of bells. “Your hair is wet,” I told her one day, “Did you take a bath?” “It is dew!” she laughed, “I’ve been lying in the grass. All morning long, I lay here waiting for the dawn.

Author: Sharon Salzberg,  The Power of Meditation: A 28-Day Programme for Real Happiness
Quote: If you’re reading these words, perhaps it’s because something has kicked open the door for you, and you’re ready to embrace change. It isn’t enough to appreciate change from afar, or only in the abstract, or as something that can happen to other people but not to you. We need to create change for ourselves, in a workable way, as part of our everyday lives.

Author: Anthony de Mello,  Awareness
Quote: The one who would be constant in happiness must frequently change.

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: There is only one all pervading God. It has only one message - Love all, encompass all and transcend the limits of the selfish gene.

Author: M.M. Kaye,  Shadow of the Moon
Quote: Common sense will nearly always stand you in better stead than a slavish adherence to the conventions.

Author: Brian Tracy,  Focal Point: A Proven System to Simplify Your Life, Double Your Productivity, and Achieve All Your Goals
Quote: Just as your car runs more smoothly and requires less energy to go faster and farther when the wheels are in perfect alignment, you perform better when your thoughts, feelings, emotions, goals, and values are in balance.

Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
Quote: Sometimes, the simple things are more fun and meaningful than all the banquets in the world ...

Author: William Shakespeare,  King Lear
Quote: Men must endureTheir going hence, even as their coming hither.Ripeness is all.

Author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables
Quote: Yes, the brutalities of progress are called revolutions. When they are over, this is recognised: that the human race has been harshly treated, but that it has advanced.

Author: Nora Ephron,  I Feel Bad about My Neck: And Other Thoughts on Being a Woman
Quote: It's always hard to remember love - years pass and you say to yourself, Was I really in love, or was I just kidding myself? Was I really in love, or was I just pretending he was the man of my dreams? Was I really in love, or was I just desperate?

Author: Malcolm X
Quote: انني احترم حق كل انسان في ان يؤمن بما يعتقد انه الصواب، وانتظر أن أعامل بالمثل.

Author: Neil Gaiman,  Odd and the Frost Giants
Quote: Talk is free but the wise man chooses when to spend his words.

Author: Jasper Fforde,  Shades of Grey
Quote: I didn't set out to discover a truth. I was actually sent to the Outer Fringes to conduct a chair census and learn some humility. But the truth inevitably found me, as important truths often do, like a lost thought in need of a mind.

Author: Kevin J. Anderson
Quote: A moment of consideration often prevents a thousand apologies

Author: Madeleine De Souvre Sable
Quote: The greatest wisdom consists in knowing one's own follies.

Author: Eckhart Tolle,  The Power of Now
Quote: Where there is anger there is always pain underneath.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Language of the Night: Essays on Fantasy and Science Fiction
Quote: I believe that maturity is not an outgrowing, but a growing up: that an adult is not a dead child, but a child who survived. I believe that all the best faculties of a mature human being exist in the child. . . . that one of the most deeply human, and humane, of these faculties is the power of imagination.

Author: Michael Bassey Johnson
Quote: A person is wise if he listens to millions of advice and doesn't implement any of it.

Author: Andy Andrews,  The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective
Quote: Remember, young man, experience is not the best teacher. Other people's experience is the best teacher. By reading about the lives of great people, you can unlock the secrets to what made them great.

Author: أحمد خيري العمري,  تسعة من عشرة
Quote: اود ان اقول لك: ان بعد كل خيار هناك خيارات اخرى.. حياتنا هذه ليست خيارا واحدا نؤديه ونستسلم بعدها لكل ما يحدث بنا. حياتنا ليست مفترق طريق منفرد و وحيد نختار اي جهة سنسلك وينتهي الامر بعدها.. ابدا.. كل خيار يفتح سلسلة من الخيارات. وكل مفترق طريق يحوي خلفه سلسلة من مفترقات طرق.. وفي كل خطوة من خطوات حياتنا يوجد قدران، نختار واحدا منهما بملء ارادتنا..

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: The light of compassion opens the petals of the heart. When the petals of the heart unfold fragrance spreads across the valley.

Author: E.L. Konigsburg,  From the Mixed-Up Files of Mrs. Basil E. Frankweiler
Quote: I've been the oldest child since before you were born

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: Words rich in meaning can be cheap in sound effects.

Author: Otto von Bismarck
Quote: It is the destiny of the weak to be devoured by the strong.

Author: Horace
Quote: he who is greedy is always in want

Author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb,  The Bed of Procrustes: Philosophical and Practical Aphorisms
Quote: Wit seduces by signaling intelligence without nerdiness.

Author: Roman Payne
Quote: When I touched her body,I believed she was God.In the curves of her formI found the birth of Man,the creation of the world,and the origin of all life.

Author: Matsuo Bashō
Quote: Summer grasses,All that remainsOf soldiers' dreams

Author: Flannery O'Connor,  Mystery and Manners: Occasional Prose
Quote: When there is a tendency to compartmentalize the spiritual and make it resident in a certain type of life only, the spiritual is apt gradually to be lost.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version
Quote: Lady Wisdom will be your close friend; and Brother Knowledge will be your pleasant companion.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  $3.33
Quote: I wouldn’t advise making a four-year commitment to eventually land an $8.00/hour job. Skip college. Read Wikipedia for free instead.

Author: Flannery O'Connor
Quote: The operation of the Church is entirely set up for the sinner; which creates much misunderstanding among the smug.”(August 9, 1955)

Author: Audre Lorde
Quote: For we have been socialized to respect fear more than our own needs for language and definition, and while we wait in silence for that final luxury of fearlessness, the weight of that silence will choke us.

Author: George Saunders
Quote: In art, and maybe just in general, the idea is to be able to be really comfortable with contradictory ideas. In other words, wisdom might be, seem to be, two contradictory ideas both expressed at their highest level and just let to sit in the same cage sort of, vibrating. So, I think as a writer, I'm really never sure of what I really believe.

Author: Malinda Lo,  Huntress
Quote: All you can do is make your decisions based on what you know now.

Author: Mario Benedetti
Quote: After all Death is a Symbol that there was Life.

Author: W. Somerset Maugham
Quote: What do we any of us have but our illusions? And what do we ask of others but that we be allowed to keep them?

Author: George Eliot,  Daniel Deronda
Quote: It is a common sentence that knowledge is power; but who hath duly considered or set forth the power of ignorance? Knowledge slowly builds up what ignorance in an hour pulls down.

Author: Thomas Paine
Quote: He who dares not offend cannot be honest.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Your decision to be, have and do something out of ordinary entails facing difficulties that are out of the ordinary as well. Sometimes your greatest asset is simply your ability to stay with it longer than anyone else.

Author: Arthur Schopenhauer
Quote: Ordinary people merely think how they shall 'spend' their time; a man of talent tries to 'use' it.

Author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
Quote: If men could learn from history, what lessons it might teach us. But passion and party blind our eyes, and the light which experience gives us is a lantern on the stern, which shines only on the waves behind us.

Author: Plutarch
Quote: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Inheritance
Quote: The future will be what it will, and fretting about it will only make your fears more likely to come true.

Author: Jaeda DeWalt
Quote: They are called, "SELF-worth"and "SELF-esteem"for a reason... we can't let others decide what we are worth, that is so dangerous! Empower yourself!

Author: J.L. Carr,  A Month in the Country
Quote: If I’d stayed there, would I always have been happy? No, I suppose not. People move away, grow older, die, and the bright belief that there will be another marvelous thing around each corner fades. It is now or never; we must snatch at happiness as it flies.

Author: Karen Blixen,  Out of Africa
Quote: A visitor is a friend, he brings news, good or bad, which is bread to the hungry minds in lonely places. A real friend who comes to the house is a heavenly messenger, who brings the panis angelorum.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Leaves of Grass
Quote: TO the States or any one of them, or any city of the States, Resist much, obey little, Once unquestioning obedience, once fully enslaved,Once fully enslaved, no nation, state, city of this earth, ever after-ward resumes its liberty.

Author: Sonia Rumzi
Quote: Suffering teaches joy.

Author: Confucius
Quote: Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: When you know the knower within, you don't need to know further. When you know the meditator within, you don't need to meditate further. When you truly know the worshiper in you, you are to be worshiped.

Author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb,  The Bed of Procrustes: Philosophical and Practical Aphorisms
Quote: A prophet is not someone with special visions, just someone blind to most of what others see

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: If you are not vegan, please consider going vegan. It’s a matter of nonviolence. Being vegan is your statement that you reject violence to other sentient beings, to yourself, and to the environment, on which all sentient beings depend.

Author: Helen Rowland
Quote: a wise woman puts a grain of sugar in everything she says to a man, and takes a grain of salt with everything he says to her.

Author: Bret Easton Ellis
Quote: what's right? If you want something, you have the right to take it. If you want to do something, you have the right to do it.

Author: Zora Neale Hurston,  Dust Tracks on a Road
Quote: Grown people know that they do not always know the way of things, and even if they think they know, they do not know where and how they got the proof.

Author: Matthew J. Kirby,  Icefall
Quote: In life, the hardest decisions often have to be made more than once. But each time, it gets easier.

Author: Amanda Hocking,  Wisdom
Quote: Forever is a really long time, you know? What do you do with forever?""The same thing you do when you don't have forever."He smiled wanly. "Live.

Author: Sanober Khan
Quote: Wordsare powerfulforces of nature.they are destruction.they are nourishment. they are flesh. they are water.they are flowers and bone.they burn. they cleansethey erase. they etch. they can eitherleave youfeelinghomelessor brimmingwith home.

Author: Michel de Montaigne,  The Complete Essays
Quote: It is a disaster that wisdom forbids you to be satisfied with yourself and always sends you away dissatisfied and fearful, whereas stubbornness and foolhardiness fill their hosts with joy and assurance.

Author: Sara Teasdale,  Love Songs
Quote: WisdomWhen I have ceased to break my wings Against the faultiness of things, And learned that compromises wait Behind each hardly opened gate, When I can look Life in the eyes, Grown calm and very coldly wise, Life will have given me the Truth, And taken in exchange -- my youth.

Author: Gautama Buddha
Quote: Few among men are they who cross to the further shore. The others merely run up and down the bank on this side.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: A photograph shouldn't be just a picture, it should be a philosophy.

Author: Leo Tolstoy
Quote: People of limited intelligence are fond of talking about "these days,"imagining that they have discovered and appraised the peculiarities of "these days"and that human nature changes with the times.

Author: Eric Micha'el Leventhal
Quote: The closer you come to knowing that you alone create the world of your experience, the more vital it becomes for you to discover just who is doing the creating.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: If an apology is followed by an excuse or a reason, it means they are going to commit same mistake again they just apologized for.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: Never underestimate your power to change yourself; never overestimate your power to change others.

Author: Amit Ray
Quote: Science is observing truth in the light of head. Religion is observing truth in the light of heart. Humanity is using both the lights. And education is developing that humanity.

Author: K.M. Johnson,  Knowing the Struggle Is Over!
Quote: Just because you're in a situation, doesn't mean you have to be that situation. You're not the situation you're in!

Author: Sarah Ferguson
Quote: Lord, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to hide the bodies of those people I had to kill because they pissed me off!

Author: Matthew Kelly,  Rediscover Catholicism: A Spiritual Guide to Living with Passion & Purpose
Quote: We don't want to think about our weaknesses. We don't want to talk about them, and we certainly don't want anyone else to point them out. This is a classic sign of mediocrity, and this mediocrity has a firm grip on the Church and humanity at this moment in history.

Author: Leonardo da Vinci
Quote: Wisdom is the daughter of experience

Author: Santosh Kalwar
Quote: All our wisdom is stored in the trees.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Develop the winning edge; small differences in your performance can lead to large differences in your results.

Author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  A Wizard of Earthsea
Quote: What good is power when you're too wise to use it?

Author: Robin Jones Gunn
Quote: There are two words that you should use frequently in your youth: ´sorry´ and ´thank-you´. Use the first one as often as possible, so that on your death bed all that you have to say to your friends is ´thank-you!´.

Author: Friedrich Nietzsche,  Thus Spoke Zarathustra
Quote: You tell me: 'Life is hard to bear.' But if it were otherwise why should you have your pride in the morning and your resignation in the evening?Life is hard to bear: but do not pretend to be so tender! We are all of us pretty fine asses and asseses of burden!

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: If you are driven by fear, anger or pride nature will force you to compete. If you are guided by courage, awareness, tranquility and peace nature will serve you.

Author: Carmen Martín Gaite,  El cuento de nunca acabar.
Quote: La rutina no está tanto en las cosas como en nuestra incapacidad para crear a cada momento un vínculo original con ellas, en nuestra tendencia a leerlas por la falsilla de lo rutinario, de lo ya aprendido. Hay que seguir dejando siempre abierta la puerta al cuarto de jugar.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: To assess the quality of thoughts of people, don't listen to their words, but watch their actions.

Author: Sarah Addison Allen
Quote: You'd be surprised how easy some things can be, things you never thought you'd do, when you take self-respect out of the equation.

Author: Raheel Farooq
Quote: The intelligent have plans; the wise have principles.

Author: Walter Lippmann
Quote: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.

Author: Paul Brunton
Quote: When every situation which life can offer is turned to the profit of spiritual growth, no situation can really be a bad one.

Author: Karl Popper
Quote: While differing widely in the various little bits we know, in our infinite ignorance we are all equal.

Author: Raymond E. Feist
Quote: Don't assume the world evolved in the order in which you discovered it.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: The man armed with knowledge has a better chance of survival than the man who is simply the fittest. Knowledge is the true strength. Muscle is where the myth is.

Author: Confucius
Quote: he who will not economize will have to agonize

Author: John Stuart Mill,  On Liberty
Quote: the only way in which a human being can make some approach to knowing the whole of a subject, is by hearing what can be said about it by persons of every variety of opinion, and studying all modes in which it can be looked at by every character of mind. No wise man ever acquired his wisdom in any mode but this; nor is it in the nature of human intellect to become wise in any other manner.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: Hide yourself in God, so when a man wants to find you he will have to go there first.

Author: Dale Carnegie,  How to Win Friends and Influence People
Quote: If you argue and rankle and contradict, you may achieve a victory sometimes; but it will be an empty victory because you will never get your opponent's good will.

Author: Benjamin Franklin
Quote: The best way to see Faith is to shut the eye of Reason.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Sun Watches the Sun
Quote: You not only are hunted by others, you unknowingly hunt yourself.

Author: Wil Zeus,  Sun Beyond the Clouds
Quote: We never realize just how many other lives we can help when their paths cross our own.

Author: Queen Elizabeth I,  Letters
Quote: The use of sea and air is common to all; neither can a title to the ocean belong to any people or private persons, forasmuch as neither nature nor public use and custom permit any possession therof.

Author: Omar Khayyám
Quote: Oh, come with old Khayyàm, and leave the Wise To talk; one thing is certain, that Life flies; One thing is certain, and the Rest is Lies; The Flower that once has blown forever dies.

Author: Rumi
Quote: A craftsman pulled a reed from the reedbed,cut holes in it, and called it a human being.Since then, it's been wailing a tender agonyof parting, never mentioning the skillthat gave it life as a flute

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: We can no more justify using nonhumans as human resources than we can justify human slavery. Animal use and slavery have at least one important point in common: both institutions treat sentient beings exclusively as resources of others. That cannot be justified with respect to humans; it cannot be justified with respect to nonhumans—however “humanely” we treat them.

Author: Jaeda DeWalt
Quote: Don't let others box you into their idea of what they think you should be. A confined identity is a miserable way to exist. Be you and live free. Trust that in living true to yourself, you will attract people that support and love you, just as you are.

Author: Tariq Ramadan
Quote: The more you look into and understand yourself, the less judgmental you become towards others.

Author: Benjamin E. Mays
Quote: It is born in mind that the tragedy of life does not lie in not reaching the goal. The tragedy of life lies in having no goal to reach.

Author: C.S. Lewis
Quote: The next best thing to being wise oneself is to live in a circle of those who are.

Author: Elizabeth Gilbert,  Eat, Pray, Love
Quote: True wisdom gives the only possible answer at any given moment, and that night, going back to bed was the only possible answer.

Author: Theodore Roethke
Quote: In a dark time, the eye begins to see.

Author: Amit Ray,  Nonviolence: The Transforming Power
Quote: Compassion is all inclusive. Compassion knows no boundaries. Compassion comes with awareness, and awareness breaks all narrow territories.

Author: Margaret Wander Bonanno
Quote: It is only possible to live happily ever after on a daily basis.

Author: A.S. Byatt,  Possession
Quote: The individual appears for an instant, joins the community of thought, modifies it and dies; but the species, that dies not, reaps the fruit of his ephemeral existence.

Author: Rumi
Quote: Where lowland is, that's where water goes. All medicine wants is pain to cure.

Author: Jonathan Tropper,  One Last Thing Before I Go
Quote: The thing about living alone is that it gives you a lot of time to think. You don't necessarily reach any conclusions, because wisdom is largely a function of intelligence and self-awareness, not time on your hands. But you do become very good at thinking yourself into endless loops of desperation in half the time it would take a normal person.

Author: Margaret Maron,  Bootlegger's Daughter
Quote: Every time we start thinking we're the center of the universe, the universe turns around and says with a slightly distracted air, 'I'm sorry. What'd you say your name was again?

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: There are two paths of which one may choose in the walk of life; one we are born with, and the one we consciously blaze. One is naturally true, while the other is a perceptive illusion. Choose wisely at each fork in the road.

Author: Harriet Evans,  Happily Ever After
Quote: Everyone's allowed to be in love with the wrong person at some point. In fact, it's a mistake not to be.

Author: Pope Benedict XVI
Quote: The human person finds his perfection "in seeking and loving what is true and good.

Author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
Quote: Pull the string and it will follow wherever you wish. Push it, and it will go nowhere at all.

Author: Stephanie Perkins,  Lola and the Boy Next Door
Quote: Cricket Bell.” I smiled into my phone. “How did you get so wise?

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: Not only do you become what you think about, but the world also becomes what you think about. Those who think that the world is a dark place are blind to the light that might illuminate their lives. Those who see the light of the world view the dark spots as merely potential light.

Author: Traci Harding,  The Dragon Queens
Quote: Only a female could be as calculating and have the foresight that destiny requires,' the gypsy explained. 'Now fate is a man,' he went on, 'no planning, just go with the flow and see what tomorrow brings.

Author: William Blake
Quote: What is grand is necessarily obscure to weak men. That which can be made explicit to the idiot is not worth my care.

Author: Jack Tempchin
Quote: Just remember this, my girl, when you look up in the sky you can see the stars and still not see the light.

Author: Benjamin Disraeli
Quote: But what minutes! Count them by sensation, and not by calendars, and each moment is a day.

Author: Christopher Paolini,  Inheritance
Quote: Go slowly, so that you do not bite your tail by accident.

Author: Marcus Tullius Cicero,  Selected Works
Quote: We must not only obtain Wisdom: we must enjoy her.

Author: Marcel Proust
Quote: Reading is at the threshold of the spiritual life; it can introduce us to it. It does not constitute it ... There are certain cases of spiritual depression in which reading can become a sort of curative discipline ... reintroducing a lazy mind into the life of the Spirit.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: Your teacher might be a child who takes you by the hand and asks you a question that you hadn't considered before, and your answer to the child is your answer to yourself.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Learning isn't acquiring knowledge so much as it is trimming information that has already been acquired.

Author: Dannye Williamsen
Quote: Your life is always under construction. It is your job to learn howto untangle the threads and weave a tapestry that matches your desires.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: When you are lonely for a while don't get restless, if you had born alone, you are going to die alone then for sometime you can certainly live alone.

Author: Anonymous,  The Dhammapada
Quote: The fool who knows his folly Becomes wise by that fact.But the fool who thinks he's wise - He's called 'a fool' indeed!

Author: Samuel Johnson
Quote: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.

Author: Hesiod
Quote: That man is best who sees the truth himself. Good too is he who listens to wise counsel. But who is neither wise himself nor willing to ponder wisdom is not worth a straw.

Author: Joe Vigil
Quote: There are two goddesses in your heard. The Goddess of Wisdom and the Goddess of Wealth. Everyone thinks they need to get wealth first, and wisdom will come. So they concern themselves with chasing money. But they have it backwards. You have to give your heart to the Goddess of Wisdom, giver her all your love and attention, and the Goddess of Wealth will become jealous, and follow you.

Author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel
Quote: It is not what he has, nor even what he does, which directly expresses the worth of a man, but what he is.

Author: Nelson Algren,  A Walk on the Wild Side
Quote: Never play cards with a man called Doc. Never eat at a place called Mom's. Never sleep with a woman whose troubles are worse than your own.

Author: Khaled Hosseini,  A Thousand Splendid Suns
Quote: She wished she could visit Mariam's grave, to sit with her awhile, leave a flower or two. But she sees now that it doesn't matter. Mariam is never very far.... Mariam is in her own heart, where she shines with the bursting radiance of a thousand suns.

Author: Hsin Hsin Ming
Quote: When love and hate are both absent, everything becomes clear and undisguised. Make the slightest distinction, however, and heaven and earth are set infinitely apart. If you wish to see the truth, then hold no opinions for or against anything. To set up what you like against what you dislike is the disease of the mind.

Author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer,  Child of All Nations
Quote: Kehidupan lebih nyata daripada pendapat siapapun tentang kenyataan.

Author: Audrey Farrell
Quote: learn from the past live in the present plan for the future

Author: Socrates
Quote: Are you not ashamed of caring so much for the making of money and for fame and prestige, when you neither think nor care about wisdom and truth and the improvement of your soul?

Author: Bill W.
Quote: For the wise have always known that no one can make much of his life until self-searching has become a regular habit, until he is able to admit and accept what he finds, and until he patiently and persistently tries to correct what is wrong. – Bill W.

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir
Quote: Cheap booze is a false economy.

Author: Christy Leigh Stewart
Quote: Every concept of reality is all in our head, belief is what makes truth.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Blood of Olympus
Quote: After his experience with Minos, Nico realized that most spectres held only as much power as you allowed them to have. They pried into your mind, using fear or anger or longing to influence you. Nico had learned to shield himself. Sometimes he could even turn the tables and bend ghosts to his will.

Author: Erich Maria Remarque,  All Quiet on the Western Front
Quote: For us lads of eighteen they ought to have been mediators and guides to the world of maturity, the world of work, of duty, of culture, of progress -- to the future.

Author: Joan Borysenko
Quote: Perhaps the hardest lesson to learn is not to be attached to the results of your actions.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book Has No Title
Quote: One of the most productive ways a government can spend money on the people is by building more prisons. That’s what makes the US so great. That’s what freedom is all about.

Author: H. Rider Haggard,  She
Quote: Ah! how little knowledge does a man acquire in his life. He gathers it up like water, but like water it runs between his fingers, and yet, if his hands be but wet as though with dew, behold a generation of fools call out, 'See, he is a wise man!' Is it not so?

Author: John Gierach,  Death, Taxes, and Leaky Waders: A John Gierach Fly-Fishing Treasury
Quote: Sure, it was your idea and your fly, but he caught the big fish. Remember, fairness is a human idea largely unknown in nature.

Author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: New International Version
Quote: Wisdom is justified by all her children.Luke 7:35

Author: Dalai Lama XIV
Quote: The topic of compassion is not at all religious business; it is important to know it is human business, it is a question of human survival.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: You must become the producer, director and actor in the unfolding story of your life.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. Specifically ages 18-81.
Quote: Love is the science of reducing your sound while upping the amplitude of another person.

Author: Confucius,  The Wisdom Of Confucius
Quote: It is when those who are not strong enough have made some moderate amount of progress that they fail and give up...

Author: George Burns,  Doctor Burns' Prescription for Happiness
Quote: Money is the root of all evil.' Then we hear, 'A fool and his money are soon parted.' What are they talking about? If money is so evil, shouldn't it be, 'A wise man and his money are soon parted'? And another thing, how does a fool get money in the first place? I know some fools who have a lot of money, but they won't tell me how they got it, and I won't tell them.

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: Listen. Pay attention. Treasure every moment.

Author: Andy Andrews,  The Noticer: Sometimes, All a Person Needs Is a Little Perspective
Quote: It’s obvious you kids are smart-school and good teachers will do that for you-but wisdom is something altogether different. Wisdom can be gathered in your downtime. Wisdom that can change the very course of your life will come from the people you are around, the books you read, and the things you listen to or watch on radio or television.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Old words are reborn with new faces.

Author: Mark Twain,  Pudd'nhead Wilson
Quote: Behold, the fool saith, "Put not all thine eggs in the one basket"- which is but a matter of saying, "Scatter your money and your attention"; but the wise man saith, "Pull all your eggs in the one basket and - WATCH THAT BASKET."- Pudd'nhead Wilson's Calendar

Author: George Jones
Quote: There are questions I'm still not wise enough to answer, just wise enough to no longer ask.

Author: Clarence Darrow,  Why I Am An Agnostic and Other Essays
Quote: The fear of God is not the beginning of wisdom. The fear of God is the death of wisdom. Skepticism and doubt lead to study and investigation, and investigation is the beginning of wisdom.

Author: Scott Adams
Quote: Ask a deeply religious Christian if he’d rather live next to a bearded Muslim that may or may not be plotting a terror attack, or an atheist that may or may not show him how to set up a wireless network in his house. On the scale of prejudice, atheists don’t seem so bad lately.

Author: CrimethInc.,  Evasion
Quote: A day unemployed is like a bagel- even when it's bad, it's still pretty good...

Author: J.I. Packer
Quote: Confidence that one's impressions are God-given is no guarantee that this is really so, even when they persist and grow stronger through long seasons of prayer. Bible-based wisdom must judge them.

Author: Isaiah Berlin
Quote: The fox knows many things, but the hedgehog knows one big thing.

Author: Brian Tracy
Quote: Success equals goals; all else is commentary.

Author: David Zindell,  The Broken God
Quote: Before, you are wise; after, you are wise. In between you are otherwise

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: Ethical veganism represents a commitment to nonviolence.

Author: Matthew Kelly,  Rediscover Catholicism: A Spiritual Guide to Living with Passion & Purpose
Quote: The notion of freedom proclaimed by the modern world is anti-discipline. But true freedom cannot be separated from discipline.

Author: Lincoln Patz
Quote: Before the fruits of prosperity can come, the storms of life need to first bring the required rains of testing, which mixes with the seeds of wisdom to produce a mature harvest.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  Love quotes for the ages. And the ageless sages.
Quote: I had to hand it to him, leaving the empty glove lying on the bed was an apt metaphor for love. Two things I can say about my grandpa are that he is wise, and his left hand is probably cold.

Author: Pope John Paul II,  Blessed Are the Pure of Heart: Catechesis on the Sermon on the Mount and Writings of St. Paul
Quote: The ethos of redemption is realied in self-mastery, by means of temperance, that is, continence of desires.

Author: Henry David Thoreau
Quote: The youth gets together his materials to build a bridge to the moon, or, perchance, a palace or temple on the earth, and, at length, the middle-aged man concludes to build a woodshed with them.

Author: Craig Ferguson
Quote: People talk to old people like they're children.'Oh you're very old aren't you?' Yeah I'm old. I'm not stupid.

Author: Gary L. Francione
Quote: Veganism is an act of nonviolent defiance. It is our statement that we reject the notion that animals are things and that we regard sentient nonhumans as moral persons with the fundamental moral right not to be treated as the property or resources of humans.

Author: Walter M. Miller Jr.,  A Canticle for Leibowitz
Quote: But neither infinite power nor infinite wisdom could bestow godhood upon men. For that there would have to be infinite love as well.

Author: Aesop,  Aesop's Fables
Quote: Once a wolf, always a wolf.

Author: Rick Riordan,  The Blood of Olympus
Quote: Nico knew something about ghosts. Letting them get inside your head was dangerous. He wanted to help Reyna, but since his own strategy was to deal with his problems alone, spurning anyone who tried to get close, he couldn’t exactly criticize Reyna for doing the same thing.

Author: Wendell Berry
Quote: The past is our definition. We may strive with good reason to escape it or to escape what is bad in it but we will escape it only by adding something better to it.

Author: Ludwig Börne
Quote: Losing an illusion makes you wiser than finding a truth.

Author: Edgar Allan Poe,  The Complete Stories and Poems
Quote: Philosophers have often held disputeAs to the seat of thought in man and bruteFor that the power of thought attends the latterMy friend, thy beau, hath made a settled matter,And spite of dogmas current in all ages,One settled fact is better than ten sages. (O,Tempora! O,Mores!)

Author: Oprah Winfrey
Quote: All pain is the same.

Author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
Quote: why can't we control our anger? because we love perfection. make a little room for imperfection in our lives.

Author: Greg Hamerton,  The Riddler's Gift
Quote: Those who try to juggle wisdom, power and greed, drop one of the balls, every time.”—Zarost

Author: Erich Maria Remarque,  All Quiet on the Western Front
Quote: The idea of authority, which they represented, was associated in our minds with a greater insight and a more humane wisdom.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: In God's eyes, a man who teaches one truth and nothing else is more righteous than a man who teaches a million truths and one lie.

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Beyond all sciences, philosophies, theologies, and histories, a child's relentless inquiry is truly all it takes to remind us that we don't know as much as we think we know.

Author: Samuel Johnson
Quote: Life is not long, and too much of it must not pass in idle deliberation how it shall be spent.

Author: Jefferson Smith,  Strange Places
Quote: Wisdom cannot be stolen - it can only be shared.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  Walking on Water: Reflections on Faith and Art
Quote: Aeschylus writes, "In our sleep, pain that cannot forget falls drop by drop upon the heart and in our own despair, against our will, comes wisdom through the awful grade of God.

Author: Peter Parker
Quote: All those years I thought that it was power that brought responsibility. It's not. I was wrong.It's responsibility that brings power. It's knowing what needs to be done that brings strength. And courage.

Author: Wm. Paul Young,  The Shack
Quote: Perhaps there is supranatural: reason beyond the normal definitions of fact or data-based logic; something that only makes sense if you can see a bigger picture of reality. Maybe that is where faith fits in.

Author: Sogyal Rinpoche
Quote: What we have to learn, in both meditation and in life, is to be free ofattachment to the good experiences, and free of aversion to the negative ones.

Author: E.A. Bucchianeri,  Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
Quote: You cannot hinder someone’s free will, that’s the first law of the Universe, no matter what the decision.

Author: Mary Stewart,  The Last Enchantment
Quote: The essence of wisdom is to know when to be doing, and when it's useless even to try

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The best kind of happiness is a habit you're passionate about.

Author: Jonathan Cainer
Quote: They say you should know your limits and work within them. But how can you really know your limits unless you try to expand them?

Author: Paulo Coelho
Quote: In the long run what people think about shepherds and bakers becomes more important for them than their own destinies.

Author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer,  Arok Dedes
Quote: Tak ada brahmana angkuh. Mereka hanya lebih mengerti, lebih tahu daripada orang yang menganggap pengetahuan dan ilmu sebagai keangkuhan.

Author: Brandon Sanderson,  Elantris
Quote: The Shaod, it was called. The Transformation... When it came, the fortuante person's life ended and began anew; he would discard his old, mundane existence and move to Elantris. Elantris, where he could live in bliss, rule in wisdom, and be worshiped for eternity.Eternity ended ten years ago.

Author: William James
Quote: we have to live today by what truth we can get today and be ready tomorrow to call it falsehood

Author: Tom Robbins,  Jitterbug Perfume
Quote: Those who possess wisdom cannot just ladle it out to every wantwit and jackanapes who comes along and asks for it. A person must be prepared to receive wisdom, or else it will do him more harm than good. Moreover, a lout thrashing about in the clear waters of wisdom will dirty those waters for everyone else.

Author: Traci L. Slatton,  Immortal
Quote: Boy, the solid things you can hold in your hands are never all you've got. They're the least of what belong to you. The qualities inside you, those are what you've really got to defend yourself with.

Author: Scott Hahn,  Lord, Have Mercy: The Healing Power of Confession
Quote: As we grow detached from things, we come (with God's help) to master our desires, and we give the mastery over to God. Discipline and divine grace heal the intellect and the will of the effects of concupiscence. We can begin to see things clearly.

Author: Ricardo Reis
Quote: Para ser grande, sê inteiro: nadaTeu exagera ou exclui.Sê todo em cada coisa. Põe quanto ésNo mínimo que fazes.Assim em cada coisa a Lua todaBrilha, porque alta vive.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Creator
Quote: Heavenly bodies are nests of invisible birds.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: There is no competition of sounds between a nightingale and a violin.

Author: Thomas Merton
Quote: ....it is of the very essence of Christianity to face suffering and death not because they are good, not because they have meaning, but because the resurrection of Jesus has robbed them of their meaning.

Author: Tanjlisa Marie
Quote: Give me the facts and I will determine my own truths.

Author: L.J. Smith,  Witchlight
Quote: That was courage, Keller thought. Not doing something without being afraid, but doing something even though you were afraid.

Author: Eddie Johnson
Quote: Fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge. Only Fools despise wisdom and discipline."Proverbs 1:7 NLT

Author: Criss Jami,  Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality
Quote: A sign of a lover of wisdom is his delight in not running his mouth about things he doesn't know.

Author: Michael Anderson
Quote: Whatever you want to be in life, you're training for it right now.

Author: André Maurois,  Climats
Quote: Happiness is never there to stay [...] Happiness is merely a respite offered by inquietude.

Author: Marva J. Dawn,  Keeping the Sabbath Wholly: Ceasing, Resting, Embracing, Feasting
Quote: A great benefit of Sabbath keeping is that we learn to let God take care of us — not by becoming passive and lazy, but in the freedom of giving up our feeble attempts to be God in our own lives.

Author: Lao Tzu
Quote: If lightning is the anger of the gods, then the gods are concerned mostly about trees.

Author: Aristotle,  The Nicomachean Ethics
Quote: The pleasures arising from thinking and learning will make us think and learn all the more. 1153a 23

Author: Graham Greene,  Loser Takes All
Quote: She was not too young to be wise, but she was too young to know that wisdom shouldn't be spoken aloud when you are happy.

Author: Matthew Kelly,  Rediscover Catholicism: A Spiritual Guide to Living with Passion & Purpose
Quote: Superficiality is the curse of the modern world.

Author: Ken Kesey,  One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Quote: It's the truth, even if it didn't happen......if they don't exist, how can a man see them?

Author: Carroll Bryant
Quote: A sin is nothing more than regret. Not for doing it once, but doing it again when you know you’re going to regret it.

Author: Amit Kalantri
Quote: The most dangerous irony is, people are angry with others because of their own incompetence.

Author: Shannon L. Alder
Quote: The only way to move from your reality to God’s reality is through people who love you.

Author: Amanda Hocking,  Wisdom
Quote: If Peter Pan had been real, he would've gone mad and killed everyone in Neverland.

Author: Paul Auster,  The Brooklyn Follies
Quote: it's a rare day when she speaks in anything but platitudes--all those exhausted phrases and hand-me-down ideas that cram the dump sites of contemporary wisdom

Author: Christopher Hitchens,  Hitch-22: A Memoir
Quote: Hardest of all, as one becomes older, is to accept that sapient remarks can be drawn from the most unwelcome or seemingly improbable sources, and that the apparently more trustworthy sources can lead one astray.

Author: Carl Sandburg
Quote: Tell no man anything, for no man listensYet hold thy lips ready to speak.

Author: Madeleine L'Engle,  A Circle of Quiet
Quote: When I start a new seminar I tell my students that I will undoubtedly contradict myself, and that I will mean both things. But an acceptance of contradiction is no excuse for fuzzy thinking. We do have to use our minds as far as they will take us, yet acknowledge that they cannot take us all the way.

Author: Chidi Okonkwo
Quote: Knowledge is like an endless resource; a well of water that satisfies the innate thirst of the growing human soul. Therefore never stop learning... because the day you do, you will also stop maturing.

Author: Shimon Peres
Quote: The most important thing in life is to dare. The most complicated thing in life is to be afraid. The smartest thing in the world is to try to be a moral person.

Author: Pablo
Quote: Reading all the quotes in the world won’t make you or me into Plato, Gandhi Or Einstein, just like watching hundreds games of soccer won’t make you a soccer player or taking a yoga class will make u a yogini, or reading a golf book will make you a golfer. We need to put the Knowledge to practice and that is the challenge. Put it to work for you, make the effort to Follow Through

Author: Tyra Banks
Quote: A lot of young girls think that the opposite of fake is rudeness. And just as ugly as fake is, so is saying whatever is on your mind because it's the truth.

Author: George Eliot
Quote: What should I do—how should I act now, this very day . . . What she would resolve to do that day did not yet seem quite clear, but something that she could achieve stirred her as with an approaching murmur which would soon gather distinctness.

Author: ابن قيم الجوزية
Quote: The slave is not afflicted with a punishment greater than the hardening of the heart and being distant from Allah. For the Fire was created to melt the hardened heart. The most distant heart from Allah is the heart which is hardened. If the heart becomes hardened, the eye becomes dry.

Author: Pablo
Quote: Words of Wisdom (wow): Be Still. Let Go.Flow.Breathe.Believe.Allow.Grow.Align.Be the Light.Be Awake.Be Aware.Anticipate.Participate.Embrace Change.Take that...Chance.Love.You Are Loved.Rise to the Occasion.Fuel your Motivation & make the world become a better place ☯

Author: David Starr Jordan
Quote: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; Skill is knowing how to do it, and Virtue is doing it.

Author: Tina Carreiro,  Power of the Moon
Quote: We all have scars, Mia; they are supposed to make you stronger, not paralyze you.” ~Cole

Author: Laurence Hope
Quote: For this is Wisdom; to love, to liveTo take what fate, or the Gods may give.To ask no question, to make no prayer,To kiss the lips and caress the hair,Speed passion's ebb as you greet its flowTo have, -to hold -and -in time, -let go!

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Sign and Its Children
Quote: To come to nothing through something is the way to outside from both sides.

Author: Pope John Paul II,  Blessed Are the Pure of Heart: Catechesis on the Sermon on the Mount and Writings of St. Paul
Quote: In suffocating the voice of conscience, passion carries with itself a restlessness of the body and the senses: it is the restlessness of the "external man."When the internal man has been reduced to silence, then passion, once it has been given freedom of action, so to speak, exhibits itself as an insistent tendency to satisfy the senses and the body.

Author: Jonas Salk
Quote: Are we being good ancestors?

Author: صبا الحرز,  الآخرون
Quote: كم نميل الى تذكر الاشياء بصورة مثالية لمجرد ان انتهاءها يستدعى منا المزيد من اللطف حيالها , مندرجين تحت طائلة "اذكروا محاسن موتاكم

Author: Benny Bellamacina
Quote: Cheapen words and they'll cheapen you

Author: Helen Hayes
Quote: If you rest, you rust.

Author: Kathleen Norris
Quote: The Christian religion asks us to put our trust not in ideas, and certainly not in ideologies, but in a God Who was vulnerable enough to become human and die, and Who desires to be present to us in our ordinary circumstances.

Author: Sogyal Rinpoche
Quote: How many of us are swept away by what I have come to call an 'active laziness'?It consists of cramming our lives with compulsive activity, so that there is no time at all to confront the real issues.

Author: T.F. Hodge,  From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
Quote: Let discernment be your trustee, and mistakes your teacher.

Author: Richard Wagner,  The Ring of the Nibelung
Quote: Many's the man/ who thought himself wise/ but what he needed/ he did not know...

Author: Henry David Thoreau
