Quote: Our moments of inspiration are not lost though we have no particular poem to show for them; for those experiences have left an indelible impression, and we are ever and anon reminded of them.

Author: Syed Muhammad Naquib al-Attas,  Islam: The Concept of Religion and The Foundation of Ethics and Morality
Quote: To know how to put what knowledge in which place is wisdom (hikmah). Otherwise, knowledge without order and seeking it without discipline does lead to confusion and hence to injustice to one's self.

Author: Wayne W. Dyer
Quote: Remember, purpose is about giving...All you can do with your life is to give it away in the service of others.

Author: Earl Nightingale
Quote: We tend to live up to our expectations.

Author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer,  Arok Dedes
Quote: Dia yang terlalu tinggi di atas singgasana tidak pernah melihat telapak kakinya. Dia tak pernah ingat, pada tubuhnya ada bagian yang bernama telapak kaki. Pendengarannya tidak untuk menangkap suara dewa, juga tidak suara segala yang di bawah telapak kaki. Ia hanya dengarkan diri sendiri. Suara murid Bapa ini takkan sampai kepadanya. Untuknya yang paling tepat hanya dijolok.

Author: Carolyn Mackler,  Vegan, Virgin, Valentine
Quote: The one thing I do remember is that as I retraced my steps through all the familiar streets of my life, Inow felt completely lost.

Author: عبد الكريم بكار
Quote: إن اللغة ناقل غير كفء، وإن الناس حين يسمعون كلامًا يفهمونه في ضوء ما لديهم من خلفيات معرفية، بل إن كثيرًا منهم يقرؤون تلك الخلفيات ويبلورونها عوضًا عن الاشتغال بفهم ما سمعوه.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: Everything that looks too perfect is too perfect to be perfect.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  The Creator
Quote: Color is the overpowering of black; white – the final victory over black.

Author: Kris Kristofferson
Quote: Tell the truth. Sing with passion. Work with laughter. Love with heart. 'Cause that's all that matters in the end.

Author: Walter Wangerin Jr.
Quote: Mirrors that hide nothing hurt me. But this is the hurt of purging and precious renewal - and these are the mirrors of dangerous grace.

Author: Walt Whitman,  Song of Myself
Quote: I am of old and young, of the foolish as much as the wise,Regardless of others, ever regardful of others,Maternal as well as paternal, a child as well as a man,Stuffed with the stuff that is course, and stuffed with the stuff that is fine, one of the nation, of many nations, the smallest the same and the the largest

Author: Samuel Johnson
Quote: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: The universe never complains.When you're wrong or right,She always loves and cares,She always gives and shares. When you get lost she becomes the light,Helps you to find what is right. But she never forgetsTo show you the light.

Author: Simon Zingerman,  We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
Quote: Using your talent, hobby or profession in a way that makes you contribute with something good to this world is truly the way to go.

Author: John Bunyan
Quote: What God says is best, indeed is best, though all men in the world are against it. Seeing, then, that God prefers his religion; seeing God prefers a tender conscience; seeing they that make themselves fools for the kingdom of heaven are wisest; and that the poor man that loveth Christ is richer than the greatest man in the world that hates him: Shame, depart, thou art an enemy to my salvation.

Author: Haruo Shirane,  Early Modern Japanese Literature: An Anthology, 1600-1900
Quote: If love goes too far, it turns into cruelty.

Author: Isocrates
Quote: Spend your leisure time in cultivating an ear attentive to discourse, for in this way you will find that you learn with ease what others have found out with difficulty.

Author: Frank Stella
Quote: What you see is what you see

Author: Paul Brunton
Quote: He is beginning to master wisdom when he tries to learn how not to try.

Author: Jack Kornfield
Quote: Wisdom says we are nothing. Love says we are everything. Between these two our life flows.

Author: Christine de Pizan,  The Treasure of the City of Ladies
Quote: Women particularly should concern themselves with peace because men by nature are more foolhardy and headstrong, and their overwhelming desire to avenge themselves prevents them from foreseeing the resulting dangers and terrors of war. But woman by nature is more gentle and circumspect. Therefore, if she has sufficient will and wisdom she can provide the best possible means to pacify man.

Author: Alexei Maxim Russell,  Why Not-World
Quote: Incredibly intelligent people always seem odd to those who are not as sharp.

Author: Peggy Vincent,  Baby Catcher: Chronicles of a Modern Midwife
Quote: Childbirth is normal until proven otherwise.

Author: Abraham Lincoln
Quote: A house divided cannot stand.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  This Book is Not FOR SALE
Quote: In a battle of believability, the winner is the one with the best body language, not the clearest logic.

Author: Ann Herendeen,  Phyllida and the Brotherhood of Philander : a Bisexual Regency Romance
Quote: You think money can solve any problem, but all it s good for is buying the things it can, and leaving you free to pursue the things it can't.

Author: Georgia O'Keeffe
Quote: It's not enough to be nice in life. You've got to have nerve.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: A friend is a friend who continues to love you and like you when you don't love him or like him any more.

Author: John Witherspoon
Quote: Never read a book through merely because you have begun it.

Author: Bangambiki Habyarimana,  The Great Pearl of Wisdom
Quote: If people were employed at creating heaven on earth, everybody would be happy; instead each one is creating his own heaven by creating hell for others.

Author: Emma Campion,  The King's Mistress
Quote: That is how we become wise, by living each day attending to the lessons God puts in our path.

Author: Kentetsu Takamori,  Unlocking Tannisho: Shinran's Words on the Pure Land Path
Quote: Since living is believing, no one can be completely lacking in faith.

Author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha
Quote: FOCUS = Follow On Course Until Successful.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic,  Circling: 1978-1987
Quote: He knows he will be born again, And start fresh anew.

Author: Jean-Yves Leloup,  Compassion and Meditation: The Spiritual Dynamic between Buddhism and Christianity
Quote: The compassionate person does not require other people to be stupid, in order to be intelligent. Their intelligence is for everyone, so as to have a world in which there is less ignorance. (118)

Author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy
Quote: Peaceful disputes are maintained when men sincerely believe that they are morally, logically correct about the issues at hand. It is when neither side is really certain that wars are instigated.

Author: Nalini Singh,  Angels of Darkness
Quote: Life changes us. To wish otherwise is pointless.

Author: Jayce O'Neal
Quote: We judge others by their actions and ourselves by our intentions. We need to offer grace to all, because we all need a little grace.

Author: Hailey Edwards
Quote: Life after love was possible. I was proof. Loss taught you about yourself, burrowed in the dark parts of your soul and ate you from the inside out.

Author: Thomas Aquinas
Quote: I receive Thee ransom of my soul. For love of Thee have I studied and kept vigil toiled preached and taught…

Author: Washington Irving,  The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
Quote: Balt Van Tassel was an easy indulgent soul; he loved his daughter better even than his pipe, and, like a reasonable man and an excellent father, let her have her way in everything.

Author: Ozzie Zehner,  Green Illusions
Quote: Wind is renewable. Turbines are not.

Author: John Scalzi
Quote: The failure mode of clever is “asshole.

Author: Charles Slagle
Quote: The statement ‘There is nothing more American than an Indian’ happens to be a multidimensional paradox. Try and not say too many of those. That might open your mind to ideas that could cause sanity point loss.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: To become a true global citizen, one must abandon all notions of 'otherness' and instead embrace 'togetherness'.

Author: Debasish Mridha
Quote: You are happy when you are enthusiastic and action-oriented, not when you are luxury and pleasure oriented.

Author: Jarod Kintz,  A Story That Talks about Talking Is Like Chatter to Chattering Teeth, and Every Set of Dentures Can Attest to the Fact That No..
Quote: If you share your soup, I’ll share my wisdom. I brought a spoon, but did you bring a pen? How are you going to take notes, you fool!

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: Be aware of the high notes, of the blissful faces and their soft messages, and listen for the silent message of a highly decorated gift.

Author: Benny Bellamacina,  Little Luigi: A Musical Adventure
Quote: There's no greater show on earth than observing human nature

Author: Michel de Montaigne
Quote: The least strained and most natural ways of the soul are the most beautiful; the best occupations are the least forced.

Author: Nancy B. Brewer
Quote: Humans will never be in charge of this world, as long as dust and weeds do as they please.

Author: Toba Beta,  Master of Stupidity
Quote: Wisdom mitigates the risk of being honest.

Author: Alexandre Dumas,  The Count of Monte Cristo
Quote: Darling, has not the count just told us that all human wisdom is summed up in two words? Wait and hope.

Author: Lish McBride,  Necromancing the Stone
Quote: And someone, somewhere, was having an even worse time of it than me. I tried to keep that in mind. No matter how crappy your life, someone will probably beat you in the my-life-is-crap category. Not that I don't let myself whine a little now and then, but sometimes it's good to keep your misery in perspective

Author: Washington Irving,  The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
Quote: ...ducks and geese are foolish things, and must be looked after, but girls can take care of themselves.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: Truth is not for sale. The man who sells truths that could help and guide humanity will never have peace of mind. Share truths freely, and you will always be revealed more.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: I will not join the rat race because I'm not a rat. And I will not blindly follow a specific faith because I'm not a bat. The only race I'll take part in is for humans being humane. It's called the human race, and sadly it's got the least participants.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: For the newborn and wise, everything begins small.

Author: Suzy Kassem,  Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
Quote: Any man filled with empathy is capable of gaining valuable insights on the human condition through the suffering of others. You do not need to suffer to know suffering, but you need empathy first to identify and feel the suffering of others around you.

Author: Aeschylus
Quote: Wisdom comes alone through suffering.

Author: Colin Firth,  Speaking With the Angel
Quote: You have to be ill if you want to get better.

Author: Dejan Stojanovic
Quote: He had an answer to almost everything and he retired at an early age.
